María, 46, lives in the city of Chincha and is happily married and has four children, two of which are adults while the other two are still in her care.  María has always been a hard-working, enthusiastic person who has dedicated all her hard work, together with her husband, to provide for her family.  Unfortunately, because of the need to work to cover expenses, she was not able to get a college education.  She would have liked to very much and in her free time watches the news and educational programs on TV.  Sometimes she makes delicious "Carapulcra" and "Sopa Seca" (spicy stew and pasta) to share with her family.

On her own initiative and thanks to support from her family, a few months ago María set up a small business selling clothing.  She works as a street vendor offering her products throughout the city streets and markets.  She also sells from home.  Her work-day is approximately six hours long.  She believes business is going well because of her charisma and customer service.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise such as pants, long-sleeved t-shirts, overalls, sweaters and other items of apparel.  This will make María's business better stocked ao she can increase sales and income; and she will be able to save enough money so that she and her husband can buy their own house.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as pants, long-sleeved t-shirts, overalls, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married with four children. She is 43 years old and lives in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Judith owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 4,200 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Judith has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Judith's plan is to save her returns in order to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Ana Carmela

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende ranchos, víveres, abarrotes, refrescos, bebidas, carnes, lácteos y todos los artículos de consumo de la canasta familiar. En su tienda vende diariamente  de contado y compra también de contado, semanalmente, quincenalmente y mensualmente,  de acuerdo a la rotación de cada uno de sus productos. En los alrededores de su negocio,  todos coinciden en ir a comprar en la tienda de Ana, porque es un lugar ameno y agradable, pues se sienten muy bien atendidos y esta percepción se extiende cada vez mas entre su clientela. Por eso en la mediada en que su negocio crece,  comprar de contado y en mayor volumen se vuelve cada vez mas, un desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual   Ana Ha recurrido a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a un credikiva, mediante el cual surtirá su negocio de artículos que mas rotan diariamente, porque necesita tener un buen inventario para responder de inmediato a su clientela, que son las madres de familia que compran para preparar los alimentos de su familia. Su credikiva lo invertirá en comprar refrescos, bebidas, lácteos, enlatados, embutidos, aceite, arroz, legumbres y café. Su credikiva planea ser exitoso, porque lo hace en base a la demanda de su mercado y porque comprando en mayor volumen y de contado, ganará descuentos, que proporcionan sus proveedores, por este estilo de compra y esto es muy bueno para los ingresos de Ana.
texts.en:
Ana, 49, has a store where she sells groceries, beverages, meats, dairy products and all kinds of goods for the family shopping basket.  Every day she sells on a cash basis and also buys her products in cash, weekly, biweekly and monthly, depending on product turnover.  Everyone living nearby coincides at Ana's store because it is a nice, friendly place and they feel well cared for, which is a growing sentiment among her clientele.  Therefore, as her business grows, buying more volume in cash becomes increasingly difficult.

This is why Ana has turned to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation for a CrediKiva loan.  This will allow her to keep a stock of the daily consumption products, since she has to have enough inventory to respond immediately to her customers, who are mothers who must prepare food for their families.  She will use her loan to buy soft-drinks, beverages, dairy products, canned goods, sausage, oil, rice, legumes and coffee.  Her loan is sure to be successful because she is basing her request on market demand, and her suppliers will give her discounts for buying more volume and paying in cash.  This will be beneficial to Ana's income.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, beverages, dairy products, canned goods, sausage, oil, rice, legumes and coffee.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda hails from Talibon, Bohol. She is 49 years old and married with four children. While her husband is in the fishing business, Yolanda is into selling basic household needs through her small sari-sari store. She is also a vegetable vendor. In her store she sells cooking oil, salt, pepper, soy sauce, tomatoes, garlic, onions, spring onions and other vegetables. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables, seasoning, cooking oil, soy sauce and spices that she can resell. The additional stock would ensure that Yolanda has enough to sell to her customers. This will result in a better income for her family. She will also be able to provide nutritious food for her family. In the future, she plans another business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, seasoning, cooking oil, soy sauce and spices.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza con su credikiva anterior se sintió muy satisfecha, porque compró carnes, refrescos, cereales en mayor cantidad y sus inventarios rotaron rápidamente, porque su negocio está mucho mas surtido y esto agrada a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente, mediante el cual comprará productos de dulcería, carnes y víveres en general, porque quiere aumentar aun mas su capital de trabajo y esto lo logrará con un nuevo aporte de capital a él. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias a ustedes logré surtir mejor mi negocio e incrementar mis ventas espero continúen apoyándome para poder crecer. “
texts.en: Maritza was very satisfied with her previous CrediKiva loan since she bought meat, soft-drinks, and cereal in greater quantities; and her inventory had a quick turnover because there was more variety which customers like.  She is applying for a new loan to buy bakery products, meat and groceries in general, as she wants to increase her working capital.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  "Thanks to you I was able to improve my business and increase sales.  I hope you will continue supporting me so I can grow."

loans.use: To buy bakery products, meat and groceries in general.

loans.name: Samuel Luis

texts.es:
Samuel tiene 40 años, pero tiene un espíritu y una alegría de un joven de 15 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso y es una ciudad en la cual se pueden visitar muchos atractivos turísticos como las Líneas de Nazca, las pirámides de Cahuachi, el cementerio de Chauchilla, los acueductos de Cantalloc, entre otros, en los cuales podemos admirar lo grandioso de la cultura Nazca y en los que podemos despejarnos. Samuel en sus tiempos libres gusta de escuchar música y también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Escabeche”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres Samuel solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado terminar la escuela.

Día con día Samuel trabaja en su negocio de venta de pan y biscochos, el trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al día ya que recorre las calles de su ciudad para ofrecer sus productos el trabaja con mucho gusto en su negocio y por ello el cree que le va bien porque trabaja con ganas y sobre todo con mucha amabilidad para la atención a los clientes.

Samuel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá acondicionar  y mejorar su triciclo para vender sus productos, así como también poder comprar ingredientes para la preparación de sus panes como harina, levadura, sal, entre otros, así de esta manera tendrá una mejor herramienta para poder recorrer las calles y tener los insumos necesarios para producir sus productos, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando con gusto para cada día ir en busca de cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener una panadería propia ya que actualmente elabora sus productos en la panadería de un familiar “.
texts.en:
Samuel, 40, has the spirit and cheerfulness of a 15-year-old.  He lives in the city of Nazca which is known for its warm climate and tourist attractions such as the Lines of Nazca, the pyramids of Cahuachi, the cemetary of Chauchilla, and the aqueducts of Cantalloc, among others, which allow us to admire the splendor of the Nazca culture.  In his free time, Samuel enjoys listening to music and eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious "Escabeche" (chicken made with onion and vinegar).  Because of Samuel's parents' lack of resources he was unable to finish his seconday education, but he would have liked to.

Every day Samuel goes out to sell bread and cakes.  He works around 12 hours a day and attends to an average 15 customers as he goes through the city streets peddling his products.  He enjoys his work very much and believes business is going well because he works hard, being especially kind and providing good service to his customers.

Samuel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he is able to upgrade the 3-wheel vehicle he uses to sell his products.  He can also buy ingredients to make bread such as flour, yeast, salt, etc., so this will give him the best tool he needs for his work and the ingredients necessary to make his products.  He will be able to increase his income and continue working hard to meet his goal, which is: "To have my own bakery because the products I sell are made at a relative's bakery".

loans.use: To upgrade his vehicle and buy supplies (flour, yeast, salt, etc.).

loans.name: 13 Campanas Group

texts.es:
El comité “13  Campanas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní.  Son 13 las mujeres que se unen en este comité para poder luchar juntas y trabajar unidas.
María es miembro de este grupo, ella tiene una despensa con la cual surte a sus vecinos, y a las otras personas que acuden a su negocio. La meta de María es poder seguir creciendo y agradando su local.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, gaseosas, enlatados, productos a granel y demás. Agradece por ola ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "13 Campanas" was formed by several neighbors in the city of Santaní.  There are 13 women who joined the group to struggle and work together.

María is a member of the group and she runs a store where she sells to neighbors and other people who stop by.  Her goal is to continue growing and expanding her shop.

She is requesting a loan to buy meats, sodas, canned goods, bulk products, etc.  She is grateful for the assistance she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy meat, sodas, canned goods, bulk products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy roof tiles, plastered clay bricks, cement, lime powder, bricks.

loans.name: Las Perlas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación está integrado por 16 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2009,  se encuentran  en el 10º ciclo, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y respeto mutuo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Francisca ella se dedica  a la  venta de verduras en general y también a la venta de arvejas, porotos, huevos caseros y  gallina casera. Cuenta la Sra. Francisca  que el crédito que solicita de la fundación lo utilizará para la compra de verduras de todo tipo, para que de esa forma siga dándoles una buena variedad a sus clientes. Ella esta agradecida por el apoyo que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group comes from the town of Encarnación and it is composed of 16 women, who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. They have been working with Fundación Praguaya since 2009, and they are currently in their 10th cycle, working all together with cooperation and mutual respect.
Francisca is a member of this group. She sells vegetables, as well as homegrown peas and beans and home raised chicken and their eggs. Francisca told us that the loan she is requesting to Fundación Parguaya will be used to buy different kinds of vegetables, in order to continue offering good quality products to her customers. She is grateful for the support she is receiving because it will be of great help for her.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina, 30, is married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Segundina runs a traveling business selling household products in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Segundina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza, 27, is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Eliza runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Eliza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Itati Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación,  trabajan juntas desde el año 2010,  se encuentran  en el 8º ciclo, y gracias a su trabajo en conjunto han logrado salir adelante y ayudarse todas, las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Edith, ella se dedica  a la  venta de harina de maíz en su casa, cuenta que ella misma procesa el maíz, de lo que obtiene la harina fresca, la cual ofrece a sus clientes. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado formarse una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella su producto.
Cuenta la Sra. Edith   que el crédito que solicita a la fundación lo utilizará para la compra de maíz para procesarlo y así tener a la venta siempre su producto. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group was born thanks to one of its members who contacted Fundación Paraguaya. They have been working together since 2010, they are currently in their 8th cycle and thanks to their joint commitment they have succeeded in progressing in life and in helping each other out.
Edith is a member of this group and she sells cornmeal. She says she herself mills the corn to obtain the fresh cornmeal she then sells to her customers. Thanks to the good quality of her products she has succeeded in gaining established customers who always buy from her.
Edith says that the loan she is requesting to Fundación Paraguaya will be used to buy corn to mill, in order to always have cornmeal to sell. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for the opportunity she is being granted.

loans.use: To buy corn to mill it into cornmeal.

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en: Helaria is a married woman with seven children. She is 46 years old and resides in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Helaria used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Her business has grown and become successful. Now she is taking a new loan to pay labor costs for farm maintenance. She has positive hopes to be able to grow her business further.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in farm maintenance.

loans.name: Franteza

texts.en:
Franteza, 38, is married with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, running a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Franteza has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lenisa

texts.en:
Lenisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell in her business.

Lenisa has been in this business for three years and she earns further income from a general store.

Lenisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Cecilio tiene 65 años de edad, está casado con Dominga   de 60 años, vive en casa propia, es macatero hace más de diez años, además de eso  su esposa es artesana (fábrica de sobrecamas artesanales), tienen nueve hijos todos mayores que ya están independientes a ellos.
Cecilio es muy sacrificado debido a que tiene muchos hijos, y gracias a su esfuerzo todos son profesionales. Cuenta que su venta lo realiza casa por casa, recorriendo a pie los distintos lugares de su zona, le ayuda su esposa en la fabricación de la artesanía. Hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada por su buena atención y por la buena calidad de sus productos, necesita el crédito para la compra de un terreno que está pegado a su propiedad, en el cual desea tener algún día para su propio local.
Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Cecilio is 65 years old, he is married with Dominga, who is 60, and they live in their own house. He has nine adult children who are economically independent. He has been a “macatero” (street vendor) for more than ten years, while his wife is a craftswoman (she weaves artisan bedspreads).
Cecilio has had to make many sacrifices since he has many children, and thanks to his commitment they are all professionals. He says that he sells his products door to door, walking to the different areas of his town, and he helps his wife creating handicrafts. Nowadays he can count on established customers he has gained thanks to his good service and to the good quality of his products. He is requesting a loan to buy some land close to his property to install there his own shop one day.
He is grateful for the support he is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy some land.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos, está solicitando un préstamo con la idea de invertir en el negocio, comprándose prendas de vestir nuevas, con estilos diferentes, blusas, camisas, pantalones, con lo que espera mantener un buen nivel de mercadería.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, el cual le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas e incrementar el inventario, esto le ha ayudado a mejorar tambien su situación económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is requesting a loan with the intention of investing in his business. He will buy new garments in different styles such as blouses, shirts, and trousers. Carlos hopes to maintain a decent level of merchandise.

He experienced positive effects with his previous loan, which helped to improve his sales and increase his inventory. This also improved the financial situation for his family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, and trousers.

loans.name: Sérigne Ousmane

texts.fr: Sérigne ousmane gère depuis maintenant six ans une alimentation dans sa localité.Il vend des denrées alimentaires et des produits de consommation courante.Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Son commerce lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants lui permettant de subvenir à ses besoins et aux dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000 f pour acheter des sacs de riz, de l'huile et des denrées de première nécessité. Il ambitionne d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en:
Sérigne Ousmane has been running a grocery store in his neighborhood for the past six years. He sells foodstuffs and staples. He is married with three children. His business brings in substantial income that allows him to support himself and his family. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy bags of rice, some oil, and other household staples. His goal is to open a second location.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, some oil, and household staples.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 65 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lilia has a business selling rice grains in the Philippines. Lilia has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Sanny

texts.en:
Ma. Sanny is 49 years old and married with eight children.

Ma. Sanny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Ma. Sanny has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Sanny aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Melaluna

texts.en:
Melaluna, age 24, is married with one child who goes to school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Melaluna has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Melaluna has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her ice cream vending business.

Melaluna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Melaluna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her ice cream vending business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Victoria has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Victoria would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Victoriana works hard to support her family.

Victoriana has a business selling rice in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Victoriana is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Victoriana has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

loans.name: Baye Niasse

texts.fr: Baye Niasse est un jeune marié, père de deux enfants.Il exerce un commerce de cartes prépayées de téléphone des quatre opérateurs de téléphonie mobile du Sénégal.Il parcours les lieux publics comme les gares routières, les marchés pour proposer ses services.Ce travail, très difficile, lui permet quand même de générer des revenus assez importants.Il parvient ainsi à subvenir aux besoins d'entretien de sa famille et à ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des cartes de crédit orange, tigo et expresso.Il ambitionne d'implanter un kiosque fixe et de recruter des vendeurs ambulants.
texts.en:
Baye Niasse is a young married man and father of two children. He sells prepaid cards from all four mobile phone companies in Senegal. He goes around public places such as bus stations and markets to offer his merchandise. This difficult work brings in substantial income that allows him to support himself and his family. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy Orange, Tigo and Expresso cards. His goal is to open a fixed booth and hire street vendors.

loans.use: to buy Orange, Tigo and Expresso cards.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (general store) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari.

NWTF is relisting Florentina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Wilda

texts.en:
Wilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her business.

Wilda has been in this business for six years. Wilda earns additional income from a general store.

Wilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional banana to sell.

loans.name: Lesya

texts.ru: Зимой было трудное время для Леси в плане торговли. Было очень холодно и торговля была вялой. Весной дела улучшились, а к лету дело пошло очень хорошо. Поэтому нужно дополнительное вливание капитала, чтобы увеличить оборот и не упустить своего покупателя. Небольшой кредит (на этот раз Леся просит 10,000 гривен) поможет докупить необходимый товар – летние шорты и тапочки. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и продолжить благоустраивать квартиру для сына.
texts.en: Winter was a hard time for Lesya's business. It was very cold and few people came to the market. Spring saw an improvement and in summer things went back to normal. Since winter resulted in weak sales, Lesya's business requires an injection of capital so that her inventory contains items which the customers want to buy. This small loan (currently Lesya is requesting 10,000 griven) will help her purchase the necessary items - summer shorts and shoes. She hopes to be able to earn additional profits from this venture which she wants to use to help repair her son's apartment.

loans.use: to purchase summer shorts and shoes

loans.name: Jennievie

texts.en:
Jennievie is 36 years old, married, and has eight children, five in school. Jennievie works very hard to provide for her family.

Jennievie runs a sari-sari (general store) in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jennievie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Jennievie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and earns additional income as a motorcycle operator. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell,

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 42 years old, married, and has five children.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy additional grocery stock to sell.

Nancy has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income by making nipa "woven palm mats." 

Nancy aspires to save enough money to expand her business..

loans.use: to buy additional grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 62 years old, married, and has seven children.

She earns a living by selling rice seed in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice seed for her business.

Anita has been selling seeds for 10 years and also earns income by raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seed for her business

loans.name: Gomersenda

texts.en:
Gomersenda is 52 years old and married with five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Gomersenda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail for 12 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport services.

Gomersenda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 24 years old. She is widowed with one child. She operates a beauty salon and also sells cosmetics. She has been in the business for the past three years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the business.

This is her first term loan with KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of hair weaves, oils, hair sprays and hair relaxers for her business.

She hopes to purchase a plot of land where she can build a home.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Goumbo

texts.fr: Goumbo est un agent de sécurité publique qui sert depuis plusieurs années dans l'administration.Il est marié et père de six enfants.Depuis des années, il est avec sa famille , en location et paie chaque mois une bonne partie de ses revenus à son locataire.C'est pourquoi, il a démarré la construction de sa propre maison.Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 500000f pour acheter du ciment, du fer, du sable et du béton pour terminer les travaux de la maison. Son ambition est de déménager le plus tôt possible dans son nouveau domicile.
texts.en:
Goumbo is a public safety officer who has been a civil servant for several years. He is married with six children. He and his family have been living in a rented dwelling for years, and he pays a substantial portion of his income to his landlord every month. This is what has prompted him to start building his own house. 

He is seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy cement, steel, sand and concrete to finish work on the house. His goal is to move into the family’s new home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, steel, sand and concrete.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce works hard to support her family. Joyce is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.  Joyce has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Joyce would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Air Force veteran John, 49, is a single father who decided to open his Kyle, Texas, business, Big Jon Plumbing Services, after working with major plumbing companies. John first entered the plumbing business at the age of 16 when looking for a summer job. Thereafter, he joined the Air Force where he attended plumbing classes to learn more. Upon leaving the Air Force, John received his plumbing license. He also helped build an Arizona start-up business to an established cooperation, but he was fired shortly after. That company later went out of business. After being fired from that job, John realized he could work for himself. 

John has now been in business for two years. For the time being, he works in conjunction with a helper. Passionate about work ethic, John would like to hire another person but won’t until he finds the right one. He says it’s easy to find a licensed plumber but it’s a challenge to find a licensed plumber who wants to do the job right. According to John, all his employees should properly execute a job, clean up after themselves and be honest with customers. 

To help with his expectations, John purchased a jetter with the funds he received on approval from Accion Texas Inc. He used the rest of the money to market his company. A jetter works similar to the water hoses at car wash stations but is much smaller as it is designed for pipes and drains. Other companies may bring a cable to expand a pipe’s passage after buildup gained from years of usage; however, that only treats the symptom for possibly half a year. The jetter John purchased sprays 3,000 pounds of water to clean pipe walls, which should keep pipes clean for two to three years.

The Accion loan allows for an opportunity to build credit for his business; without it, John says he would have to wait another two to three months to earn enough money to purchase the jetter, which  would put a stop to the quality he can provide his customers. For more information on his business and services, visit his company website at: www.bigjonplumbingservices.com.

loans.use: to purchase a power washer and market his business.

loans.name: Nebojsa

texts.en:
Nebojsa is living in Kosovo in a Serbian community. He is married and has two children. The oldest is ten years old and the youngest seven years old. To support his family, he works hard with his agricultural machine on agricultural land belonging to other people in his area. 

He is requesting the loan to buy a trailer for his cultivator. With the help of this loan he can expanded and facilitate his work. He is able to support his family through his business. He hopes to keep on making his own living in order not to ask for help from others. Nebojsha is hoping in the near future to buy a big tractor.

loans.use: To buy a trailer for his cultivator.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Named after the Egyptian bird, which has a symbolic meaning of rising in brilliance, Benu Construction is operated in Fort Worth, Texas by 37-year-old Israel. Specializing in concrete, Israel works only on outdoor projects, such as foundation work, patios and outdoor kitchens. Benu Construction also creates concrete stamps to add décor to residential and commercial buildings.

Originally from Mexico, Israel struggled with English when he moved to Texas - which hindered his job search. Since he was unsuccessful in finding a job, Israel said he had to create a job for himself, which led to the creation of his construction company.

Depending on the size of the project, Israel employs from one to ten people. He employs two full-time and ten part-time workers. Israel works with the client instead of a general contractor because he does not have enough capital to do that. However, working this way allows for more one-on-one communication between him and his client and brings better results.

A returning client, Israel first found out about Accion Texas Inc. four years ago through the Fort Worth Chamber of Commerce, but he didn’t apply for his first loan until he moved to Houston.  This is Israel’s third loan. He plans to use it mainly to purchase cedar wood and concrete, but also to obtain concrete dyes and a concrete sealer.

The loan will give him job security, Israel said, as he will earn enough capital after his current project to go straight into work on another job. 

Israel, who is the sole provider for his wife and child, also has a website for his company. Visit it here:  benuinc.com or at http://www.concretenetwork.com/contractor/benu-construction-inc-fort-worth-tx_100513.

loans.use: to purchase materials for upcoming projects.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito is 59 years old,  married and the mother of three children. For the last 12 years, she has earned a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She also earns money on the side by selling herbal medicines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to secure the financial stability of her family by building and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Slavica

texts.en:
Slavica is a hair dresser. She is living in Kosovo in a Serbian community. Slavica is married and has two children. Slavica started to work as a hair dresser 13 years ago from her home. Slavica is requesting a loan from KosInvest to buy new hair dressing tools such as a new chair and hair creams. 

This will develop her business and increase the numbers of her clients. She uses her income to support her family. She notes that this loan will improve her business and allow her to attract more clients. In the future, she plans to develop her business more.

loans.use: To buy new hair dressing tools such as a new chair and hair creams.

loans.name: Angel Francisco

texts.es: El señor Ángel Francisco  tiene más de 35 años con su negocio de venta de mercadería en general. Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir  en las compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas, trajes de baños, bolsos, calzado entre otros. El le agradece a esta fundación por haberle brindado esta oportunidad para poder mantener y salir adelante con su herramienta de trabajo lo cual le da estabilidad a el y a su familia.
texts.en: Ángel Francisco has been in business selling general merchandise for more than thirty-five years.  He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in buying shirts, pants, skirts, swimsuits, bags, footwear, etc.  He is grateful to the foundation for having provided him with this opportunity to maintain his business and continue working which provides him and his family with stability.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, swimsuits, bags, footwear, etc.

loans.name: Jelena

texts.en:
Jelena is a married woman. She is from Kosovo and she lives in a Serbian community. She is the owner of a restaurant and she sells food such as grilled meat, french fries with sausage etc. Jelena has been in this business for three years. 

In her restaurant in addition to the Serbian community she also serves Albanians and other communities who live in Kosovo. She really enjoys what she does, since she has always liked to cook. She has many plans for her business, but for the time being, only wants to gather enough capital to expand it. The borrower is requesting the loan in order to buy cooking supplies such as meat, vegetables, soft drinks and beer as well as tables and chairs to better equip her restaurant. 

She is happy for the financial support that KosInvest gives her, because this way she is certain of making progress in her work.

loans.use: To buy cooking supplies meat, vegetables soft drinks, beer tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maria Eleuteria

texts.es:
Maria, es una señora de 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una aldea del Municipio de La Esparta, Intibucá.
Doña Maria es muy trabajadora, tiene 5 años de tener establecido un negocio de vender mercadería para Damas, caballero y niños. Como  camisas y blusas, pantalones, y calzado.  Ella anteriormente vendía cosméticos en forma ambulante. De este negocio obtiene los ingresos necesarios para el estudio de sus hijos  y los gastos del hogar. 
Solicito un préstamo a Odef de 5,500 lempiras para compra de más mercadería para poder surtir su negocio y poder ofrecer variedad de producto a los clientes.
Su meta es ver el negocio más surtido y con sus ganancias cubrir gastos de estudio de sus hijos hasta que se gradúen.
texts.en:
Maria, age 38, is married and has four children.  She lives in a village in the La Esparta municipality in Intibucá.

Maria is a very hard-worker.  She established a business of selling merchandise for women, men, and children five years ago.  She sells things like shirts, blouses, pants, and footwear.  She previously sold cosmetics in an itinerant manner.  She gets the income she needs for her children’s education and the household expenses from this business.

She requested a loan from ODEF for 5,500 lempiras to buy more merchandise.  She will stock her business and be able to offer a variety of products to the customers.

Her goal is to see her business stocked more and with the income to cover her children’s educational expenses until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes and shoes to stock her business.

loans.name: Milos

texts.en:
Milos is from Kosovo. He is single and he lives in a Serbian community. Milos started his business of a shop and coffee bar two years ago in his village. He started with a small shop and now it has become a big shop. 

Milos is requesting a loan to buy a range of coffees, beverages, refrigerated food and other things for his shop. These purchases will help him to better meet the needs of the customers from all communities in his village. Milos hopes to marry and have children.

loans.use: To buy a range of coffees, beverages, refrigerated food and other things for his shop.

loans.name: Jubelyn

texts.en: Jubelyn is 35 years old, married and the mother of two children. For the last 12 years, she has worked hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her customers. Jubelyn has taken out and repaid 12 previous loans from NWTF. She also earns income from farming sugarcane. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to manufacture his original designs and buy shipping materials

loans.name: Estrella De Belen Group

texts.es: Banco Comunal estrella de belén está conformado por nueve integrantes yudit, Jessica, corina, Cristian, francisca, rosibel, marileth, julissa, Jerry, todas con diferente actividades económicas,  yudit tiene por actividad económica una pulpería desde hace tres años el financiamiento lo está solicitando para invertir en su negocio y comprar productos de consumo diario como :  arroz, frijoles, sal, azúcar, pan, huevos, galletas, tiste entre otros.
texts.en: The community bank "Estrella de Belén" is made up of nine members: Judit, Jessica, Corina, Cristian, Francisca, Rosibel, Marileth, Julissa, and Jerry, each with different economic activities.  Judit has a small store as her business, which she has been running for the past three years.  The loan she is asking for is to invest in her business and buy daily staples like rice, beans, salt, sugar, bread, eggs, cookies, and tiste (a traditional sweetened cornmeal and chocolate beverage) among other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, salt, sugar, bread, eggs, cookies, and tiste (a traditional drink) among other items.

loans.name: Norbita

texts.en:
Norbita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling Avon products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. 

Norbita has been in this business for 16 years. Norbita earns more income from selling ready to wear clothing and a general store. 

Norbita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorized machine for his boat to use for fishing

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives with her family in Macabibo, Sapang Dalaga, where she earns a living by running a store where she sells food and a variety of items that people use in their homes. She earns 2,000 PHP a month and joined GDMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living conditions. She is requesting a loan for PHP 2,100 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to save the additional revenue generated by this loan and use it to cope with any future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María Guadalupe casada de 25 años de edad con dos hijos menores de edad el cual tiene que mantener junto con su esposo, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general esta emprendedora inicio su negocio desde hace 3 años por la necesidad de tener un trabajo para ayudar a pagar en los gastos de su hogar. El financiamiento lo quiere para comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas para dama y varones, chores, ropa de niño y ropa interior para adultos, venta de cosméticos como perfumen y cremas.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe is 25 years old and married. She and her husband support their two young children. Her business involves selling general merchandise. This entrepreneur started her business three years ago because she needed to work in order to pay for the household expenses.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothing such as trousers, men’s and women’s shirts, shorts, children’s outfits, and undergarments for adults. She will also buy cosmetics to sell, such as perfumes and crèmes.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 52 years old, married, and has four children. 

Nelly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

Nelly has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income from charcoal sales and farming sugarcane. 

Nelly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg, 23, lives with her husband, mother-in-law and her son in an apartment she owns in Darkhan province, Mongolia. Her husband works for a building company. Her son is a kindergarten student. Her mother-in-law helps with her business. She just started her clothing trading business. Even though she has operated her business for not more than one month she already has many stable customers and suppliers. She is well known to customers. 

For now she has 3,000,000 Tugrik (MNT) working capital. For the coming summer, she doesn't have enough summer clothes to sell. Therefore she needs to buy more products to sell. She is a diligent and clever woman. She said "I need to expand my business more than current situation in order to open my own store." She is requesting 575,000 MNT to purchase more summer clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more summer clothes

loans.name: Cefferino Gustavo

texts.es:
CEFFERINO GUSTAVO tiene 43 años de edad de estado casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto las Blancas, Perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

 CEFFERINO GUSTAVO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz suave. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, líquidos para las plagas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para  los cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es poder seguir trabajando para cambiar el estilo de vida.
En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar mucho.
texts.en:
Cefferino Gustavo is 43, married, and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas, in De los Ríos province.

He is a member the "26th of November" communal bank, located in Recinto Las Blancas, which is part of Ventanas canton. The members of the group raise livestock and farm.

Cefferino Gustavo farms, and grows soft corn. He is applying for the loan in order to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers and pesticides.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops.

He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas. His dream is to be able to continue working to change his standard of living.

In his free time, he likes to work a lot.

loans.use: To buy seeds, urea, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Xochicalco Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de Xochicalco continúan con la misma actividad que estaban realizando, ellas agradecen a Kiva y a Vision Fund sus préstamo. 

La señora Evarista tiene 72 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene 3 hijos 1 mujer y 2 varones ya casados. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, frutas y verduras, por lo que solicitó su préstamo para comprar azúcar, arroz, huevo, chiles, jitomates, tomates, naranjas, refrescos para surtir su tienda y dar buen servicio a sus clientes. Para ella, su negocio es importante porque se ayuda y tiene ingresos para comprar comida para su familia. Además, está planeando ampliar su negocio y continuar comprando más mercancía para tener bien surtida la tienda. Evarista está contenta con el préstamo que va a recibir. Sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir trabajando para tener sus ingresos y, si Dios quiere, que crezca su negocio y que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Norberta is going to use her loan to buy bread, Sabritas-brand potato chips, sodas, and yogurt.  The rest of the members continue with their jobs.  They thank Kiva and Visión Fund for their loans.

Evarista, 72, is a widow and has three children, a woman and two men who are already married.  She has a grocery store for fruits and vegetables.

She requested her loan to buy sugar, rice, eggs, chiles, tomatoes, oranges, and sodas to stock her store and give her customers good service.  Her business is important for her because she helps herself and has income to buy food for her family.  In addition, she is planning to expand her business and continue buying more merchandise to have the store well stocked.

Evarista is happy with the loan she is going to receive.  Her dreams and hopes are to continue working to have her income and, God willing, for her business to grow and her children to not need anything.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, eggs, chiles, tomatoes, oranges, and soda.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Juana Pabla de 59 años de edad, soltero, con 10 años de experiencia, tiene por actividad economica la venta de refrescos, gracias al buen servicio que le brinda a sus clientes y los sabrosos frescos naturales que ofrece es que ha podido mantener e incrementar su clientela, el fiananciamiento lo quiere para comprar frutas para la elaboracion de sus diferentes refrescos. Como: piña, calala, zanahorias, linasa, bananos, naranjas, remolachas, chia, entre otros.
texts.en:
Juana Pabla is 59 years old, single, and has eight years of experience.  Her business involves selling soft drinks.  Thanks to the good service that she provides and the refreshing natural flavors that she offers, she has been able to maintain and increase her customer base.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits for preparing her various soft drinks.  These items include pineapple, passion fruit, carrots, linseed, bananas, oranges, beets, chia seeds, and other items.

loans.use: to buy pineapple, passion fruit, carrots, linseed, bananas, oranges, beets, chia seeds, and other items.

loans.name: Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Mi Dios es Mi Fortaleza  está conformado por  Claudia, Basilisa,Matilde,Thelma,Neuda,Socorro,Juana,Silvia,Mercedes,Filomena,Benita  Estas emprendedoras tiene herramientas de trabajo diferente pero han demostrado ser responsables , trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal, por ejemplo Juana su actividad económica  es la Artesanía El motivo del crédito es para la compra de acuarela, pínceles, Barro para la elaboración de la artesanía entre otros.
texts.en:
The “Mi Dios es Mi Fortaleza” (My God Is My Strength) communal bank’s members are:  Claudia, Basilisa, Matilde, Thelma, Neuda, Socorro, Juana, Silvia, Mercedes, Filomena and Benita.

These entrepreneurs have different work tools but they’ve shown themselves to be responsible, hardworking with a strong drive for self-improvement.

For example, Juana’s economic activity is crafts.  The reason for the loan is to buy watercolors, brushes and clay to make crafts.

Another group member is Claudia who owns a grocery store located at home that allows her to meet her obligations and provide what’s necessary for her home.

The reason for the loan is to buy basic staple items like rice, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, salt, ‘tiste’ [ground cocoa powder mixed with corn], ice and matches among others.

loans.use: to buy crafts supplies and stock merchandise among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and basic expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and basic expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Thiselani

texts.en:
Thiselani is applying for a loan to support her studies at the Maharishi Institute. This is her story:

My name is Thiselani and I will be graduating in 2013 with a Bachelor of Business Administration through Maharishi University of Management facilitated by The Maharishi Institute. My long-term goal is to become an entrepreneur and eventually open an orphanage in my community.  I believe that with education, achieving my goals and reaching my dreams becomes a possibility.  Education gives me knowledge and builds my opinions and behavior. 

I live in a family of five, and we are from Bushbuckridge, Mpumalanga.  My mother is unemployed and my father is a bar man at a game lodge.  I am the first to enter university in my family, and a  Kiva loan is important for me in order to cover my needs and to ease the financial burden on my family.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and basic expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Thandy

texts.en:
Thandy is applying for a loan to support her studies at the Maharishi Institute. This is her story:

My name is Thandy and I am 23 years old. I am studying towards a Bachelor of Business Administration through Maharishi University of Management facilitated by The Maharishi Institute. After graduation I hope to open a business in the community I am from and assist youth in career development.  I believe education is the key to ensuring a brighter future for me and my family.  I come from a large family and rely on my grandmother's state aid because both my parents are unemployed. 

I am the first person to attend university in my family, which is a responsibility I take very seriously. I hope to make education more accessible to my siblings through my own education. Through the business I want to open, I hope to empower myself, my family, and the greater community.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and basic expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Thabang

texts.en:
Thabang is applying for a loan to support his studies at the Maharishi Institute. This is his story:

My name is Thabang and I am from Soweto on the outskirts of Johannesburg. I have spent most of my schooling career in Mpumalanga and returned to Soweto late in senior school. As the only person in my family who is going to university, I am responsible to ensure that I make the best of my studies at Maharishi Institute. My education plays an important role helping me achieve my personal goals. With the help of Kiva, I will be able to complete my education and be one step closer to making my dreams a reality.  

I am currently pursuing a Bachelor of Business Administration through Maharishi University of Management facilitated by The Maharishi Institute and hope to graduate in 2013. In my spare time I enjoy reading, watching movies and spending time with friends. After graduating, I would like to open a business to serve my community in Mpumalanga. Giving back to my community is very important to me, and with a sound education I believe that I will be able to contribute in a meaningful manner.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and basic expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is applying for a loan to support his studies at the Maharishi Institute. This is his story:

My name is Solomon  and I am studying towards a Bachelor of Business Administration through Maharishi University of Management facilitated by The Maharishi Institute.  I am the first in my family to attend university and my goals after graduation are clear and focused on allowing me to be financially independent and support my family. My intentions are to gain work experience and eventually open up an agricultural business to supply local and national markets. In the future I hope to encourage young people who are addicted to drugs or are victims of peer pressure to pursue their dreams and reach their goals.  

The Kiva loan is important to me because coming to school is a challenge and focusing on my studies is difficult when I have financial worries in my mind.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and basic expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Porter

texts.en:
Porter is applying for a loan to support her studies at the Maharishi Institute. This is her story:

My name is Porter and I am a student at the Maharishi Institute. I am 24 years old and currently studying towards my Bachelor of Business Administration through Maharishi University of Management facilitated by The Maharishi Institute.  Education is important to me because it encourages me to think about life in a creative and innovative way. Sharing my experiences and what I have learned is part of my life. I believe that through sharing we grow in our minds and hearts. 

The Kiva loan will help me to complete my education and continue sharing in a meaningful way. 

In my spare time I enjoy meeting new people, cooking, baking, yoga and meditation. My family and I are Christians and regularly attend church. My mother has been able to educate two of my brothers and continues to support me. Obtaining funding from Kiva will help me ease her burden.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and basic expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and basic expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Nievel

texts.en:
Nievel is applying for a loan to support his studies at the Maharishi Institute. This is his story:

My name is Nievel and I am a 25 year old pursuing a Bachelor of Business Administration through Maharishi University of Management facilitated by The Maharishi Institute. I hope to graduate in 2013 and establish a business in my hometown. Education is an important part of achieving my entrepreneurial dreams and the Kiva loan will assist me greatly in doing this.  

My hope is to uplift my community and play a part in building our country. I hope that there will come a time when all people will share equal resources.  A Kiva loan allows me to complete my education and contribute to the growth of our nation. It is important to me to be able to financially support my family, and at the moment, my education is placing a strain on our finances. With the help of this loan, I will be able to help ease that strain.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and basic expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is married with two kids. She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. Cheryl owns and operates a nipa-making (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials) business to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and every month she earns 3,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy nipa palm to make roofing materials. Cheryl became a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To buy nipa palm to make roofing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coconut shells used to make charcoal

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 47 years old, married, and has five children. Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell.

Emily has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from electronic reloading and direct selling of Avon products. Emily aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is from Macabibo, Sapang Dalaga. She is 67 years old. Constancia is widowed and has two children. 

To make a living, Constancia runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Constancia has been in her business for eight years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Constancia is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Constancia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is from Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Evelyn is widowed and has three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles (pancit, behon, and meki), spices, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for four years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Evelyn joined GDMPC. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and basic expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Las Fresas Group

texts.es:
Las Fresas es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 10 mujeres muy trabajadora y emprendedoras, cada una de ellas realiza un actividad económica con el propósito de ganar un poco de dinero extra para ayudar a sus esposos con los gastos de su hogar y brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En esta comunidad, las principales actividades económicas son el cultivo de caña de azúcar y la recolección de las resinas de los arboles de hule.

Arianna es una de las integrantes de este grupo ella tiene la edad de 25 años, estudio la preparatoria, esta casada con Jose Luis que trabaja como jornalero y tiene un hijo, ella  platica que desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar y cuando se caso decidió buscar la manera de poder ayudar a su esposo con los gasto de su hogar y así poder ahorrar para dar a sus hijos una mejor vida. Arriana desde hace un poco mas de 2 años tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su hogar y nos dice que al principio fue difícil ganar clientela pero ella no se desanimo al contrario gano clientes dando un buen trato y teniendo surtido su negocio, ella esta muy contenta con su tienda ya que puede trabajar sin descuidar a su familia y hasta su esposo le ayuda a despachar. Un préstamo de Fundación Realidad ayudaría a compra de jabón, aceite, frijol, arroz, sopa,pasta dental, servilletas, dulces y refrescos para poder resurtir su negocio. ella desea que con esta inversión su negocio continué creciendo ya que quiere en un futuro poder pagar los estudios de su hijo 

las demás integrantes de este grupo son:
Dominga venta de pollo
Martha venta de calzado
Florinda venta de abarrotes 
Alejandra venta de cosméticos
Lucero venta de dulces
Francisca venta de antojitos 
Nora Yasmin venta de abarrotes
Mireya venta de pan
Maria del Rocio venta de calzado
texts.en:
'Las Fresas' is the name of this group of 10 very hard-working and entrepreneurial women.  Each member of the group carries out their own business activity with a view to earning a little extra money to help their husbands with their household expenses and provide her family with a better quality of life.  The main business activities in this community are growing sugar cane and collecting resin from rubber trees.

Arianna is one of the members of this group.  She is 25 years old and has a high school education.  She is married to Jose Luis who works as an agricultural laborer and the couple have one son.  Arianna tells us that her parents taught her to work when she was very young and when she got married she decided to find a way to help her husband with their household expenses so that they could save up and give their children a better life.  For a little over two years, Arianna has been running a small grocery store in her home.  She tells us that, at first, it was difficult to attract customers but she didn't become discouraged.  On the contrary, she attracted customers by providing good customer service and keeping her business stocked.  She is very happy with her store because she can work without having to neglect her family.  Even her husband helps her to serve the customers.  A loan from  Fundación Realidad would help her to buy soap, oil, beans, rice, soup, toothpaste, napkins, sweet treats and soft drinks so that she can re-stock her business.  She hopes that, as a result of this investment, her business will continue to grow because she would like to be able to pay for her son's future education.

The other members of this group are:
Dominga - chicken sales
Martha - shoe sales
Florinda - grocery sales
Alejandra - cosmetics sales
Lucero - sale of sweet treats
Francisca - snack sales
Nora Yasmin - grocery sales
Mireya - bread sales
Maria del Rocio - shoe sales

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, oil, cookies, candy, soup, beverages, cheese, cream, milk, salt, sugar, ham and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 52 years old, married, and has six children. Ludivina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Ludivina has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling rice. Ludivina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El Sr. Germán está casado con la Sra. Cerafina hace varios años, tienen 5 hijos mayores, todos ya independientes a ellos.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicada en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad. Comenta que se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando  educaron a sus hijos que son universitarios. El Sr. Germán además  de la despensa trabaja como albañil de  obras.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de primera necesidad para poder surtir su negocio, como ser arroz, fideo, azúcar y otros. El agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues es una gran oportunidad de crecimiento para el.
texts.en:
Germán has been married to Cerafina for several years.  They have five grown children, and all of them are independent.

Together they set up a grocery store in their house, which is located in a strategic place in the city.  He says they started with a little capital that they got from other jobs they had done previously as salaried workers.  Thanks to the work they are doing they have educated their children, who are university graduates.  In addition to the grocery store, Germán works as a bricklayer.

He is requesting the loan to buy basic needs products to stock his store.  He will buy things like rice, noodles, sugar, and others.  He is grateful for the help that he is receiving.  It is a great growth opportunity for him.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Nilbia Lucia

texts.es:
Nilbia  tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive en una colonia situada en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula. 
Doña Nilbia desde muy joven aprendió a costurar en maquina, y hace 15 años emprendió su propio negocio donde confecciona todo tipo de calzado, como sandalias de tacón, plataforma, zapatillas, zapatos formal de mujer, lo que el cliente le solicite. La experiencia  para dedicarse a confeccionar calzado la obtuvo en su trabajo anterior.  Cuenta con 3 empleados que le ayudan en el negocio para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes. Doña Nilbia trabaja con clientes del mercado los cuales le encargan los estilos que tiene demanda para la venta, y manifiesta que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene mucha demanda.  Con este negocio ella apoya con los gastos del hogar 
Esta solicitando un tercer préstamo de 10,000.00  lempiras para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los zapatos y poder cumplir con la demanda de encargo que tiene con los clientes.
Su plan en el futuro es extenderse mas y su negocio establecerlo en un local del centro de la ciudad, para que su negocio sea mas conocido y crezca en clientes.
texts.en:
Nilbia is 42 years old and a single mother with two children who are already independent.  She lives in a subdivision in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Doña Nilbia learned to sew with the use of a machine at a very young age.  She started her own business 15 years ago and produces all types of footwear such as high heels, platform shoes, slippers, and women's formal shoes that her customers request.  Her experience with making shoes was obtained through a previous job.  She has three employees who help with the business so that she can satisfy the demand from her customers.  Doña Nilbia works with customers from the market who order styles of shoes that are in demand and that they can sell.  She says that she has done very well because of the high demand.  Through this business, she is able to cover the household expenses.

She is requesting her third loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can buy raw materials for making shoes.  This will enable her to satisfy the demand from her customers.  Her plans for the future include expanding her business and establishing it in a location in the central part of the city.  In order for her business to become well-recognized, she has to grow her customer base.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Bertasal

texts.es: Don Bertasal, tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. a el siempre le ha gustado el comercio tiene aproximadamente 28 años de realizar esta actividad, el compra y vende todo tipo de achinería como ser: platos, vasos, sombreros, juguetes, mochilas, camisetas y otros. Las ventas la realizan en el centro de la ciudad, ubica su puesto en las aceras y también vende en forma ambulante. El quiere surtir su negocio de mercadería para vender en la feria de la Ciudad, y por eso solicita a ODEF y a Kiva un préstamo por 6,000.00 Lempiras, esta inversión le va permitir incrementar sus ingresos. Su esfuerzo de cada día es para ver su negocio en crecimiento y mejorar su calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Don Bertesal is 55 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives in a suburban section of San Pedro Sula.  

Bertesal has always enjoyed the retail trade and has been in this line of work for approximately 28 years.  He buys and sells all types of miscellaneous goods such as plates, glasses, hats, toys, backpacks, T-shirts, and other items.  His sales are conducted in the central part  of the city where he has a sidewalk stand, but he also sells as a traveling vendor.  He wants to restock his business with merchandise that he can sell at the city fair.  

For this reason, Bertasal is requesting a loan from ODEF and Kiva for 6,000 HNL.  This investment will help to increase his earnings.  He strives each day to see his business grow so that his family's quality of life can improve.

loans.use: to buy toys, backpacks, plates, plastic cups, T-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Marta Nelly

texts.es:
Maria Nelly tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos en el  Municipio de Omoa, Cortes.
Doña Maria hace 10 años se propuso tener su propio negocio una pulpería. Ella vende productos del grano básico, embutido, lácteo, refrescos etc. Este ha sido su fuente de ingresos y por eso ha trabajado mucho para sacarlo adelante manteniéndolo surtido y atendiendo bien e sus clientes. Con los financiamientos que ODEF le ha otorgado le han ayudado mucho a mantenerlo estable.
Este préstamo que solicito es el quinto y lo necesita para surtir con más producto su negocio comprando granos, refrescos, carnes, embutidos, dulces etc. Así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de producto.
Su afán es siempre mantener su negocio estable y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old and a single mother of two children.  She lives with them in the town of Omoa, Cortes.

Doña Maria started her own grocery business 10 years ago.  She sells products such as basic grains, sausages, dairy products, soft drinks, and other items.  This business serves as her source of income.  For this reason, she works hard in order to keep it well-stocked so that she can provide good service to her customers.  With the help of the loans that ODEF has provided, she has managed to keep her business stable.  

This loan she is requesting is her fifth one.  She needs to restock her business with more products and plans to buy grains, soft drinks, meats, sausages, candy, and other items.  As a result, she will be able to offer a variety of products to her customers.  Her hope is to always maintain a stable business and keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy grains, soft drinks, meats, sausages, candy, and other items.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 54 years old, married, and has three children. Marlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Marlyn has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice. Marlyn aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell in her store

loans.name: Cándido Rafael

texts.es: Cándido con su credikiva anterior,  fue donde sus proveedores y compró al por mayor y de contado telas, hilos, pegantes y esponjas, con los cuales redujo sus costos, porque le dieron muy buenos descuentos. Como le fue bien, hoy está aplicando a un credikiva que lo invertirá materias primas  nuevamente, para acceder a nuevos descuentos e ir capitalizando cada vez más con este ahorro. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchos agradecimientos por el apoyo económico brindado hasta la fecha, les pido que sigan apoyando a las microempresas,  para nosotros seguir mejorando nuestro nivel de vida. “
texts.en:
With his previous credikiva loan, Cándido went to his suppliers and bought fabric, thread, adhesives and foam, at wholesale and for cash. This way, he reduced his costs, because they gave him very good discounts. 

As it went well for him, today he is applying for a credikiva which he will again invest in raw materials in order to access new discounts and build up his working capital more and more with this saving. 

His message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "Many thanks for the financial support offered to date. I ask you to continue supporting small businesses, so that we keep improving our standard of living“

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, adhesives and foam.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for her fishing business.

loans.name: Mbocayaty Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Mbocayaty, debido a que así se llama la calle en donde viven, han asumido el compromiso de mantener unido el grupo. Actualmente se encuentran en el octavo ciclo con calificación excelente.
Claudia se dedica a la venta de comidas de toda clase, lo cual hace desde un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ella gracias a su trabajo ha salido adelante y ha podido ayudar a su familia con todo aquello que más necesitan.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, panificados, aderezos y demás insumos. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha utilidad.
texts.en:
This communal bank goes by the name Mbocayaty, because that is the name of the street where they live.  They have made a commitment to stay united as a group.  They are currently in their 8th loan cycle, and have an excellent credit rating.

Claudia has a business selling all types of food.  She has had this business for a while, and so has a very good customer base.  Thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead and help her family with all the things that they need the most.

She is requesting a loan to buy meat, condiments, bakery products, salad dressings and other supplies.  She is grateful for the help that she is receiving, because it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, bakery products, salad dressings and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and beauty products to use in her beauty salon

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui, 32, lives with her husband and three children in a small house that she owns in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. Two of her children are in secondary school, while her youngest is in kindergarten. Her husband works for a mining company. Her brother-in-law operates a cell phone business and she works for him while planning to open her own cell phone sales and repair center.  She is well known among locals for her quality work, and is committed to open her own business and someday have many customers. She is a hardworking and outgoing person, and says that "my children's education is very important. I have to work for their future." She is requesting a loan for MNT 1,250,000 to buy cell phones to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cell phones to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
