This is Carolina, 46, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a driver. She is also a mother to her three children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Carolina oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy spare parts and accessories, as well to maintain the motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Carolina dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. These meetings also give her an opportunity to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories, as well as to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de algunos productos que son necesarios para la granja, como el concentrado para los cerdos, maíz, afrecho, vitaminas, para darle buen mantenimiento a la granja, teniendo lo necesario para alimentarlos y proporcionarles una condición adecuada en el crecimiento de los cerdos.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que le ayudó a incrementar el número de cerdos en la granja, al mismo tiempo le ayudó para realizar mejores ventas a sus clientes y poder obtener la ganancia necesaria que son el objetivo por el cual se encuentra trabajando, ya que le ayuda a ofrecer a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Zoila is requesting a new loan so that she can buy a few supplies that she needs for her farm such as concentrated feed for her pigs, corn, bran, and vitamins. This will provide her with what she needs to maintain her farm and feed her pigs so that they can grow under adequate conditions.

The effect of her previous loan was positive. The money helped to increase the number of pigs on her farm. At the same, she was able to improve her sales and expand her customer base. As a result, she generated the revenue she needed to continue working and providing for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, corn, bran, and vitamins.

loans.name: Norgelita

texts.en:
Norgelita is 34 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Norgelita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from fish vending and rice selling.

Norgelita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 47 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Susana has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fish vending.

Susana aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vivincia

texts.en:
Vivincia is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells bananas and other fruit in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell.

Vivincia has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Vivincia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

NWTF is relisting Anita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Lady Grace

texts.en:
Lady Grace is 28 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store.

Lady Grace has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Sol Naciente” está conformado por 15 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, venta de pan amasado, venta de confites, feriantes, venta de desayuno, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la comuna de Quilicura, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Yesenia, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un beatle de color blanco, encima lleva puesto un chaleco de color gris y una chaqueta de color café, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquería, , desde hace 2 años. Realizó algunos cursos de especialización, lo que le permitió perfeccionarse y emprender en su negocio. Se desempeña en sus labores de peluquería de lunes a viernes y su horario de trabajo es de 10ºº hasta las 21ºº horas, también se dirige a los domicilios particulares de sus clientes.
Su mercadería la compra en varias distribuidoras que se especializan en vender productos para el cabello.
Con el crédito comprará tijeras, implementos para navaja, capas, gorros, guantes, entre otros.
Una de las metas de Yesenia en su negocio, son tener la oportunidad de adquirir un local propio, en el cual pueda atender a sus clientes.
Yesenia vive con su esposo quien se dedica al rubro de taxista, y su hija de 7 años quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel personal es tener su casa propia, y a nivel laboral tener su local propio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza.
Quilicura es una comuna perteneciente a Santiago, capital de Chile, ubicada en el extremo noroeste de región metropolitana. El origen del nombre de la comuna viene del mapudungun (lengua mapuche): "kila", que significa “tres” y "kura" que significa “piedra”, por lo que se deduce que el nombre de Quilicura equivale a "tres piedras", como  el nombre que le dieron los primeros habitantes de este valle en referencia a los tres cerros que son perfectamente visibles y que delimitan la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called “Emerging Sun”, is composed of 15 entrepreneurs who are dedicated to commerce, specifically selling clothing, doughy bread, sweets, breakfasts, services, and a stallholder, among others. They all live in the commune of Quilicura, located in the city of Santiago. 

Yesinia, president of the communal bank group, is standing in the front row of the photo, first on the left, dressed in a white 'beatle', under a gray vest and a brown jacket. Her dark chestnut hair is worn loose.

Yesinia has offered hair care for some 2 years. She has taken specialized courses that helped improve her skills and facilitated her business. She works Monday through Friday from 10:00 am until 9:00 pm, and also visits her customer's residences.

Yesinia buys her merchandise from various distributors who specialize in selling products for the hair. With this loan she will buy scissors, shaving implements, capes, caps, and gloves, among other items. One of Yesinia's goals for her business is to have an opportunity to acquire her own shop where she can attend to her customers.

She lives with her husband, a taxi driver, and her 7-year-old daughter who is a student. Yesinia's personal dreams are to have her own house and her own beauty shop, to generate greater income and thus, obtain a better quality of life.

Yesinia is very content and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business. In addition, she feels very comfortable with her group, since they are united, respectful, and confident.

Quilicura is a commune pertaining to Santiago, Chile's capital, located in the extreme northeast of the metropolitan region. The origin of the commune's name comes from “mapudungun” in the Mapuche language: “kila” means 3, and “kura” means stone, which we deduce makes the name “3 stones”. The name was chosen by the original inhabitants, with reference to 3 hills that are clearly visible and mark the boundaries of the commune.

loans.use: buy scissors, shaving implements, capes, caps, gloves, among other supplies.

loans.name: Vicente Rufino

texts.es:
Vicente Rufino tiene 59 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene seis hijos, vive con la conyugue y los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto las Blancas, Perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas

Vicente Rufino se dedica a labores agrícolas a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para poder seguir sembrando. El sueño  es poder tener una buena casa y darles buena educación a los hijos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y viajar.
texts.en:
Vicente Rufino is 59 years old, married, and has six children. He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.

He belongs to VRC 26 De Noviembre, which is located in the precinct of Las Blancas, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. This small community works in stockbreeding and agriculture. 

Vicente Rufino is a farmer. He grows corn. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed-killers. With the help afforded by this loan, he will be able to purchase what he needs to continue growing his crops. 

His dream is to be able to have a nice house and give his children a good education.

In his spare time, he enjoys listening to music and traveling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, urea, and liquid weed-killers.

loans.name: Bol Sof

texts.en:
Bol is a 45-year-old businessman who lives in Nimule. He is married and has six children between the ages of 6 and 22 years old, four of whom go to school.
 
Bol runs a general store and has been in business for five years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through the loan officers' promotions and he is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more goods.  

In five years, he wants to open a big shop.

His major challenge includes currency exchange at the border. 

He is happy with Finance Sudan's loans.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, soap, beans.rice etc

loans.name: Mara Omaku

texts.en:
Mara Omaku is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10 years old, two of whom go to school. 

Mara runs a general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients and she is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more goods.  

In five years, she wants to open a big shop.

Her major challenge includes currency exchange at the border. 

She is happy with Finance Sudan's loans.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, beans, green peppers, etc

loans.name: John Barnaba

texts.en:
John is a 25-year-old businessman who lives in Nimule. He is married and has one child who is two years old. His child does not go to school. 

John runs a general store and has been in business for two years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions and he is taking a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase more goods.  

In five years, he wants to open a big shop.

His major challenge includes the high cost of transporting his goods

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, etc

loans.name: Angua Paskal

texts.en:
Angua is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has three children between the ages of two and eight years old, two of whom go to school. 

Angua runs a general store and has been in business for six years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions and she is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase more goods.  

In five years, she wants to open a big shop.

Her major challenge includes price inflation.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, beans, onions, etc

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Adriana works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Adriana is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her banana business.

Adriana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Agnes Moini

texts.en:
Agnes Moini is a 45-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has five children between the ages of 8 and 18 years old, five of whom go to school. 

Agnes runs a general store and has been in business for 10 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions and she is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more goods.  

In five years, she wants to open a big shop.

Her major challenge includes the high cost of transporting her goods

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, irish potatoes, etc

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie works hard to support her family. Anna Marie is married and has a business selling clothes and beauty products in the Philippines. Anna Marie has been in this business for five years now.

Anna Marie has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, Anna Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 28 years old. She is married and has four children, who are in school.

Maribeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maribeth has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maribeth has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is a 29-year old resident of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She provides for her child's needs from her small monthly income of 8,000 PHP, which she earns from the banana cropping business she has run for three years as a supplement to her husband's income. 

In 2011 she became a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP through GDMPC microfinance to buy farm chemicals. Ma. Liza wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals.

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en:
Zorigt, 34, is a taxi driver who works in the districts of Darkhan, the second largest city. He has been running his business for a year and has earned a profit. He wants to expand his business. He has a plan of buying one more car that uses natural gas. And his brother will use that car for a taxi business. They have a plan of business team. Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in cities.  In the winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents use a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  Additionally, the smoky and extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons for Mongolian air pollution. 

In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems, and buy cars that use natural gas. Credit Mongol believes that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on both the environment and the health of Mongolians. 

Zorigt is requesting a loan to cover the cost of buying car which uses natural gas for expanding and improving his business.

loans.use: To cover the cost of buying car which uses natural gas for expanding and improving his business.

loans.name: Santos Alfredo

texts.es:
Santos de 21 años de edad, soltero, vive en una aldea  del Municipio de Intibucá, La Esperanza.
Santos es un  joven dedicado a la agricultura, desde muy pequeño ha trabajado con su familia, hace 4 años ha logrado establecer su propia parcela donde produce papas. Donde el vive es una zona apta para la agricultura, en este caso de papa. Le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo y le apoya su familia con los gastos en el hogar. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. 
Es su primer préstamo de 22,000 lempiras que solicita y lo va invertir en insumos para la siembra de papas y asistencia técnica, con el propósito de mejorar el nivel de producción. 
Su meta es seguir vendiendo el producto a buen precio y comprar más tierras para trabajarlas
texts.en:
Santos, 21, is single living in a village in the municipality of Intibucá, La Esperanza.  

Santos is a young man dedicated to agriculture; he’s worked with his family since he was little.  Four years ago he managed to set up his own parcel of land where he grows potatoes.  The area he lives in is apt for agriculture, in this case potatoes.  He spends most of his time at it and helps his family cover household expenses.  He sells his crops in the local market.

This is his first, 22,000 lempira, loan request that he will use to buy farm supplies for his potato crops and for technical assistance in order to improve his production level.  His goal is to continue selling his crops at a good price and to buy more land to farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Rebuscadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Rebuscadoras"se originó a traves de promociones que se hicieron en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.
La sra Hilda, es Presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a vender los producto que producen en su plantío de cultivo, su deseo es seguir progresando con la Fundación Paraguaya y que el grupo se vaya fortaleciendo cada día más, manifiesta que se siente muy a gusto en su comité y espera muchos beneficio más que la Fundación le están ofreciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando en su campo y así ayudar a mantener a su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The “Rebuscadoras” (Gleaners) committee arose through informational events held in the neighborhood.  All of the members are from the same zone; they are acquaintances and neighbors from the neighborhood.

Hilda is group president.  She sells products she produces in her fields.  Her wish is to continue making progress with Fundación Paraguaya and that the group continues to get stronger every day.  She states that she feels very comfortable in her committee and expects to have many more of the benefits that the Fundación is offering.

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other supplies to continue working her fields and thus help to support her family.  She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Editha has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Victoria Eloisa

texts.es:
VICTORIA ELOISA tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene 6 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 24, 23, 22, 19, 17 y 8 años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

 Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto las Blancas, Perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas

VICTORIA ELOISA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, insecticidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para los cultivos.

El sueño es poder tener una buena casa y darles una mejor educación a los hijos. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música y viajar.
texts.en:
Victoria Eloisa, 49, is married and has six children.  She lives with her husband and children, ages 24, 23, 22, 19, 17, and 8.  She is a member of 26 de Noviembre Communal Bank, located in the Las Blancas district in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  This bank works in livestock and farming.  Victoria Eloisa works in agriculture growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, manure, and insecticide.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy the fertilizers she needs for her crops.

Her dream is to be able to have a good house and give her children a better education.  In her free time she likes to listen to music and travel.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, manure, and insecticide.

loans.name: Maria Eusebia

texts.es:
María Eusebia tiene 47 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos de 23, 21 y 11 años,  vive con el conyugue y con los hijos menores de  21 y 11 años de edad en ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto las Blancas, Perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

María Eusebia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, urea, abonos químicos, semillas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar sin ningún tipo de problema los fertilizantes y la semilla de buena calidad.
El sueño es poder tener una casa y un terreno propio.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta ser responsable y disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
María Eusebia, 47, is married and has three children who are 23, 21 and 11 years old.  She lives with her spouse and younger children who are 21 and 11 years old in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “26 de Noviembre” communal bank located in Las Blancas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved in activities related to agriculture and livestock.

María Eusebia farms rice, corn and pigeon peas.  She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, urea, chemical fertilizer and seeds.

With help from the loan she will be able to buy fertilizers and good quality seeds problem-free.  Her dream is to own a house and her own field.  She likes to be responsible with her free time and to enjoy the festivals in the community.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Luciano Evaristo

texts.es:
Luciano Evaristo tiene 58 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto las Blancas, Perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Luciano Evaristo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido para la maleza, semillas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insecticidas.  Las compras lo hará en Ventanas. El sueño es poder prepararse y seguir trabajando.
En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Luciano Evaristo, 58, is in a common law relationship and has two children.  He lives with his spouse and children in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the “26 de Noviembre” communal bank located in Las Blancas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved in activities related to agriculture and livestock.

Luciano Evaristo farms rice, corn and pigeon peas.  He’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, urea, insecticide, weed killer and seeds.

With help from the loan he will be able to buy insecticide.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is to be able become prepared and to continue working.  He enjoys working in the fields in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es una mujer de 43 años pero tiene un espíritu y una alegría de una joven de 20 años, junto a su pareja tiene 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 3, 6 y 9 años, a quienes quiere muchísimo y junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como agricultor,  trabajan muy duro para poder darles una vida digna para que sean mejores que ella.  La vivienda de Adelaida se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, Ica se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido, también se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial se cultiva el algodón, pallares, uva, esparrago, entre otros; encontramos también la laguna de Huacachina, la cual se encuentra en medio de maravillosas dunas, en las cuales se practica mucho el sandboard. En sus tiempos libres a Adelaida le gusta mucho cocinar, es muy buena y lo que más le gusta preparar es uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “olluquito con Charqui”. Adelaida solo tuvo estudios primarios, debido a que sus padres no tenían muchos recursos económicos, pero a ella le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora.

Todos los días Adelaida se levanta muy temprano para abrir su pequeña bodega en la cual vende abarrotes, verduras, entre otros, ella trabaja alrededor e 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de buena calidad a precios cómodos y por la amabilidad con la cual atiende a sus clientes.

Adelaida está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora para su negocio, ya que actualmente no cuenta con esta herramienta y en algunos casos en algunas oportunidades no tiene  donde guardar y conservar algunos productos, asi de esta manera ella podrá mejorar la atención a sus clientes y conservar en buen estado sus productos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando día a día para poder seguir en busca de cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 43 years old, but she has the spirit and happiness of a 20 year old.  Together with her partner she has three children who are 3, 6, and 9 years old who she loves very much.  Her husband works as a farmer.  They work very hard to give their children a decent life so that they can be better than her.  Adelaida's home is located in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm weather, agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, butter beans, grapes, asparagus, and other items, and the Huacachina lake which is located in the middle of marvelous dunes, where people like to sandboard.  In her free time, Adelaida likes to cook.  It is very good, and she most likes to prepare one of her favorite dishes, "olluquito con charqui".  Adelaida only went to primary school since her parents did not have much money, but she would have liked to study to be a teacher.  

Every day, Adelaida wakes up very early to open her small general store where she sells groceries, vegetables, and other items.  She works about ten hours a day and can serve about 25 customers every day.  She believes her business is going well because she offers good quality products at affordable prices and she serves her customers with kindness.     

Adelaida is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help, she will be able to purchase a freezer for her store, since she currently does not have one, and when she needs one, she has nowhere to store and keep some products.  This will allow her to provide better service to her customers and keep her products in good condition.  This will allow her to continue working everyday towards her dream of owning a mini-market.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Yamile Maria

texts.es: Yamile con su anterior credikiva compró ropa, calzado jeans  y perfumería en general, así mismo invirtió en 2 bicitaxis, los cuales le generarán nuevos ingresos y esto la hace muy feliz, porque puede ganar cada día un poco más. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará mercancía como perfumería ropa informal femenina calzado y 2 bicitaxis más porque su aspiración es tener toda una flota de estos vehículos transportando en la comunidad donde habita, pues allí se utiliza de manera usual para transportarse. Yamile está muy agradecida con las personas que la han financiado, porque gracias a ellas ha evolucionado en su negocio y espera que continúen con esta bonita labor.
texts.en:
Yamile used her previous Kiva loan to buy clothes, shoes, jeans and perfumery in general and also invested in two bicycle-powered rickshaws that generate new income which makes her very happy because she’s able to earn a little more every day.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy merchandise like perfumery, informal women’s clothes, shoes and two more bicycle-powered rickshaws because her hope is to own a fleet of these vehicles to provide transportation in the community she lives in because they are used there as a means of transport.

Yamile is very grateful to the people who have financed her because thanks to them she’s been evolving in her business and she hopes that they will continue with this beautiful work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and two bicycle-powered rickshaws.

loans.name: Henry Francisco

texts.es:
Henry Francisco tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en la casa con los abuelos en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto las Blancas, Perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Henry Francisco se dedica a la siembra de maíz suave, Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, ranger, líquido mata maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes. El sueño es poder tener casa y vehículo  propio.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el futbol y el baile.
texts.en:
Henry Francisco, 21, is single and has no children; he lives at home with his grandparents in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

He’s a member of the “26 de Noviembre” communal bank located in Las Blancas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved in activities related to agriculture and livestock.

Henry Francisco grows yellow corn and is asking for the loan to buy urea, seeds, Ranger [brand of herbicide] and weed killing liquid.

With help from the loan he will be able to buy fertilizer.  His dream is to have a house and vehicle of his own.  In his free time he likes to play soccer and to dance.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.es: Iluminada  de 45 años de edad vive en San Felipe al sur de la ciudad ella es la propietaria de un jardín infantil y de una escuela primaria, que funciona en este mismo barrio. Su negocio comenzó como una alternativa de trabajo para ella y su hermana, pues no encontraban la oportunidad de vincularse al sistema educativo. Iniciaron con pocos niños y poco apoco fue cogiendo un auge, debido al reconocimiento del servicio que ellas ofrecían en sus instalaciones a los niños. Gradualmente las necesidades de la comunidad crecieron y pedían a ella que  lograran escalar a licencias, para que sus hijos realizaran estudios  primarios y hoy han estructurado sus instalaciones para ello y cuentan con 80 niños en esta etapa. En su condición de docente Iluminada tiene la susceptibilidad que requiere el buen trato de los niños. Esta es la condición de éxito de su negocio que quiere hacerlo crecer mas en infraestructura, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará implementos pedagógicos para el desarrollo de la tarea docente, papelería y realizará adecuaciones a sus instalaciones para hacerlas cada día mas confortable y llena de niños felices.
texts.en: Iluminada is 45 years old and she lives in San Felipe, in the south-side of the city. She is the owner of a childcare facility and a primary school that are in the same neighborhood. She started her business as an employment alternative for herself and her sister, because they could not find another opportunity to work within the educational system. They started out with very few children, but as word spread about the service they offered and the facilities they had for children, they grew quickly. Gradually, the needs of the community grew, and they asked her to become licensed to be able to teach primary grades. Today they are set up to be able to do so, and they have 80 children enrolled. As a faculty member, Iluminada makes sure the children are treated well. They want to grow the infrastructure of the school, which is why she has applied for a loan from kiva, the first loan she has taken out through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan she will buy teaching tools for child development, process paper work and make adjustments to the facilities so that with each day their facilities become more comfortable and full of happy children.

loans.use: to buy teaching tools for child development, process paper work and make adjustments to the facilities.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo tiene 25 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto las Blancas, Perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Víctor Hugo se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz, fréjol gandul. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abono orgánico, ranger. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir la semilla de buena calidad sin ningún tipo de problemas.
El sueño es poder tener vehículo propio. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta ser amable con las personas y muy responsable en los actos
texts.en:
Víctor Hugo, 25, is single and has no children; he lives in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

He’s a member of the “26 de Noviembre” communal bank located in Las Blancas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved in activities related to agriculture and livestock.

Víctor Hugo grows corn and pigeon peas and is asking for the loan to buy urea, seeds, organic manure and Ranger [brand of herbicide].

With help from the loan he will be able to buy good quality seeds problem-free.  His dream is to have a vehicle of his own.  In his free time he likes to be kind to people and to be very responsible with his actions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa con los padres en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto las Blancas, Perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Juan Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.
El sueño es poder comprar una casa y un vehículo propio En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar mucho.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 22, is single and has no children; he lives at home with his parents in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

He’s a member of the “26 de Noviembre” communal bank located in Las Blancas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved in activities related to agriculture and livestock.

Juan Carlos grows corn and broad beans and is asking for the loan to buy urea, insecticide, weed killing liquid and Ranger [brand of herbicide].

With help from the loan he will be able to buy what’s necessary for his crops.  His dream is to buy a house and a vehicle of his own.  In his free time he likes to play sports and to work very much.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Katherine May

texts.en:
Katherine May is 29 years old and lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married and has two children.  

Katherine May owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 7,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to purchase farm chemicals. Katherine May is a new member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC. 

In the future, Katherine May dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en:
Neonita is 54 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married and the mother of six children. 

Neonita owns and operates a retail business to earn a living.  Despite her age, she manages this business herself.  Her main source of income comes from producing and selling charcoal in her community.  She has been running her business for five years.  Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP from her business.   Neonita has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC to pay the labor cost incurred to produce charcoal.  Neonita is a new member of GDMPC.  

In the future, Neonita hopes to expand her business and to purchase a motorcycle to use in her business.

loans.use: to pay the labor cost incurred to produce charcoal.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
For five years Glenda, a hardworking entrepreneur, has earned a living through direct sales of beauty products in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Glenda, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, is requesting a new loan of PHP 17000 to buy more beauty products to sell. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo Manuel

texts.es:
Ricardo es un joven de 19 años de edad,  vive en la linda ciudad de chincha la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, la mayoría de pobladores son de descendía afroperuana, son conocidos también por tener un don en la preparación de platillos típicos ya que les salen muy ricos, por ello uno de los platillos favoritos de Ricardo es la rica “Pachamanca”. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Ricardo le gusta mucho escuchar música, sobre todo porque lo ayuda a despejarse del cansancio propio del trabajo.  Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Ricardo traba en una empresa empaquetadora de huevos como obrero, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día,  su trabajo es muy delicado ya que hay que empaquetar los huevos con cuidado, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo cuidadoso cuando realiza su trabajo.

Ricardo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como construcción de paredes ya que son de adobe, asimismo tarrajeo, pintado y refacción de techo de calamina; así de esta manera el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres ya que el vive con ellos y a quienes apoya con el fruto de su trabajo, de esta manera el podrá seguir trabajando con más tranquilidad y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida a sus padres, poder tener su casa propis y formar una familia”.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 19, is a young man living in the beautiful city of Chincha which is noted for having a hot climate.  It is the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes.  Most of the residents are of Afro-Peruvian descent and are well-known for their delicious traditional dishes that they prepare very well.  One of 
Ricardo’s favorite dishes, therefore, is the delicious “Pachamanca.”  When he has free time available, Ricardo enjoys listening to music very much above all because it helps him relax after a hard day’s work.  Because of his parents’ few economic resources, he only attended secondary school but would have liked to have studied a university career.

Ricardo works very enthusiastically as a laborer in an egg-packing firm; he works about 10 hours daily.  His work is very delicate because one has to pack the eggs very carefully.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very responsible and above all very careful when doing his work.

Ricardo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to do some home improvements like building walls that are currently adobe.  He will also plaster, paint and repair the metal sheeting on the roof thus improving his parents’ quality of life since he lives with them and helps support with the fruits of his labor.  In this way he will be able to continue working with more tranquility and continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: to give his parents a good quality of life and to be able to have his own house and form a family.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Ma. Natividad

texts.en:
Ma. Natividad is 44 years old and married.  She has three children, two of whom attend school.  Ma. Natividad works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Natividad runs a business, selling beauty products directly to customers in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items including perfume, lotion and cologne.  Ma. Natividad has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to stock and sell.

In the future, Ma. Natividad would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to stock and sell.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona, 36 years old and married with four children, works hard to provide for her family. For 20 years she has been operating a veterinary-products retail business in the Philippines and also earns an income from Avon and Natasha products.

Petrona, who has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF, is requesting a new one for PHP 14500 to purchase more stocks to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon, a married mother of six, works hard to support her family with her rice-farming business in the Philippines. In order to minimize her kerosene expenses, she is requesting a PHP 4100 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

Corazon is aware that by using the solar lamp, she will not only be saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa is 56 years old.  She is married and has four children, one of whom attends school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dolorosa has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  She has been in business for 30 years.  Dolorosa has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase spare parts for maintenance.

In the future, Dolorosa would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support six children. She is married and owns a general store in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 4,100 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Rosalie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 55 years old and widowed with five children.

Anecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Anecita has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 12 years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Anecita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Zonia Esther

texts.es:
Zonia es una mujer de 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus 3 hijos, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias decidió separarse de su pareja desde hace varios años, desde entonces ella ha sido el principal soporte de su hogar, Zonia siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia; debido a la necesidad de trabajar y solventar los gastos de su hogar, Sonia no pudo cursar una carrera profesional pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de confección textil; en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina, el cual es el plato preferido por sus hijos.  
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace 4 años Esther puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de confección de prendas de vestir, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, donde puede atender hasta 10 clientes, Zonia realiza labores de reparación, compostura, corte y confección de diversas prendas, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a sus buenos trabajos, así como por su trato amable y respetuoso.
Zonia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un mostrador y diversos tipos de telas; de esta manera Zonia podrá tener sus prendas de vestir exhibidas a la vista del cliente y también podrá contar con los materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo, así ella espera poder incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, para con ellos poco a poco poder realizar la construcción y acabados de su vivienda, asegurando la seguridad y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Zonia, 53, lives in the city of Pisco with her three children.  Unfortunately, due to various circumstances she decided to separate from her spouse several years ago.  Since then, she’s been the sole support for her home.  Zonia has always been a very cheerful, enthusiastic, hardworking person who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Because of the need to work and cover household expenses, Zonia was unable to study a professional career but she would have liked to have studied textile making.  In her free time she enjoys cooking and sometimes cooks the very delicious “Ají de Gallina” which is her children’s favorite dish.

Through her own initiative and with help from her family, Esther started her own clothes-making business four years ago.  She spends about 12 hours daily at work and can tend to up to 10 customers.  Zonia does repairs and designs and sews various articles of clothing.  She believes that her business is doing well because of her good work as well as the kind, respectful way she treats customers.

Zonia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy a counter and various types of fabric so that Zonia will have her articles of clothing on display in sight of her customers; she will also have on hand necessary supplies to do her work.  She hopes thus to increase her sales and income to gradually build and finish her house insuring her family’s wellbeing and safety.

loans.use: to buy a counter and fabric.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married and has 3 kids. She is 59-years-old and lives in the Philippines. Lourdes is a farmer and she operates a vegetables production to earn her living. She has been doing this for 6 years and every month she earn 3,000.00 from this work. 

Lourdes has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 35 years old and married. She has 3 children who are in school. Analisa works very hard to provide for her children.

Analisa is a Avon dealer in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to to purchase solar lamp. She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Analisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Norady

texts.en:
Norady is 56 years old and has 4 children. She is married and one of her children is in school. Norady is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Norady has been raising pigs for 20 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Norady would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is married and has 11 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cherry is 47 years old and has 7 children who are in school.

Cherry has a rice retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Cherry has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tools used in repairing shoes.

loans.name: Waly

texts.fr: Waly est un homme marié et père de quatre enfants.Il exerce un commerce de sel dans sa localité.Il s'approvisionne chez les collecteurs de sel au niveau des grandes lagunes de la région et revend le produit en gros à des commerçants détaillants. Cette activité lui rapporte des bénéfices substantiels qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins d'entretien de sa famille et à ses propres besoins. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter 300 sacs de sel. Son ambition est de constituer une entreprise de collecte, de traitement et de commercialisation du sel.
texts.en:
Waly is a married father of four children, and works selling salt in his town. He gets his supplies from the salt collectors around the region’s large lakes, and resells his product in bulk to retail sellers. This business gives him substantial income, which allows him to provide for his family and meet his own needs. 

In order to increase his working capital, Waly has requested a loan of 300,000 francs to buy 300 bags of salt. His ambition is to create a business to collect, process and sell salt.

loans.use: To buy 300 bags of salt.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont les trois vont à l'école.Depuis maintenant sept ans, Awa exerce un commerce de tissus.Elle tient au grand marché de sa localité un magasin de vente de tissus modernes et traditionnels.Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus consistants , surtout en période de fête.Ces revenus lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins et d'entretenir sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 400 000f pour acheter des tissus.
texts.en:
Awa is a married woman and mother of four children, three of whom go to school. For seven year she has worked selling fabrics, and has a store in her town’s large market where she sells modern and traditional fabrics. This business provides her with consistent income, particularly during holiday time.

With her income Awa can provide for her family and meet her own needs. To increase her working capital, she has requested a loan of 400,000 francs to buy fabrics.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Chokola Group

texts.fr: Madame Nshobole est une cliente dynamique d’une association d’affaire Chokola. Elle est âgée de 33ans, mariée à un déclarant en douane; est  mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle est vendeuse des  pagnes  depuis  2007 et  est  au 2ème cycle de crédit chez Hekima.  Le crédit sollicité va lui servir à l’approvisionnement  de 10pièces de pagnes.  La cliente souhaite voir ses enfants finir leurs études et devenir grossistes. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en:
Nshobole is a dynamic client of the Chokola business association. She is 33 years of age and is married to a customs broker. She has seven children, all of whom are at school.

Nshobole has worked selling traditional wrap-around cloth (known as “pagnes”) since 2007, and this is her second loan with Hekima. She plans to use her loan to purchase supplies, specifically 10 lengths of traditional wrap-around cloths. She wants to see her children finish their studies, and also wants to become a wholesaler. She also thanks Hekima and asks for God’s blessings.

loans.use: To buy 10 lengths of traditional wrap-around cloth.

loans.name: Shukrani Group

texts.fr: La cliente Byabagula est une femme ambitieuse d’un groupe de crédit Shukrani. Âgée de 52ans est mariée à un chômeur  et mère des  12 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle est vendeuse des  souliers usagés depuis 2006  et  est  au 13ème cycle de crédit chez Hekima.  Le crédit sollicité lui servira d'acheter 3 ballons des souliers usagés.  La cliente souhaite construire une maison d'habitation familiale dans l’avenir.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en:
Byabagula is an ambitious woman who forms part of the Shukrani borrowing group. Aged 52, she is married to a man who is unemployed, and is mother to 12 children who are all at school. She has sold used shoes since 2006, and this is her 13th loan cycle with Hekima. 

Byabagula plans to use her loan to buy used shoes. She wants to build a family home in the future, and gives her thanks to Hekima.

loans.use: To buy three bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza  fue formado en la de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, es integrado por 19 señoras emprendedoras, las mismas son mujeres humildes y trabajadoras que buscan un mejor porvenir para ellas y sus familias.
Margarita es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, como ser jeans, remeras, pantalones, abrigos y demás. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que sus productos siempre son de muy buena calidad y a buen precio.
Solicita el crédito para surtir su local con prendas, ya que quiere surtirse, pues tiene pedidos con los cuales quiere poder cumplir.
texts.en:
La Esperanza Community Bank, formed in the city of Caaguazú, is made up of 19 enterprising, modest, and hardworking women who are looking for a better future for themselves and their children.

Margarita is one of the members.  She sells clothing, such as jeans, t-shirts, pants, coats, and other garments.  She says she has very good customers because her products are always high quality and well priced.

She is requesting the loan to supply her store with clothing because she wants to stock up, to be able to fill her requests.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 34 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham province. With his common-law wife, also his business partner, he is supporting three school-aged children. Sok and his wife work together cultivating rice for their livelihoods. Rice agriculture is the sole income source for Sok’s family.

In the previous month, Sok bought a threshing machine on credit from his supplier in order to improve his business activities. With this machine Sok can provide threshing services to local villagers for additional income. And now, he would like a loan from HKL and Kiva in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 to pay his outstanding balance to his supplier. He is very grateful for the financial support given to him to further develop his business and help his family.

loans.use: to pay his outstanding balance to his supplier.

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Luisa del Rosario tiene 43 años de edad es cadada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto las Blancas, Perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas

Luisa del Rosario se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, insecticidas, líquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para poder seguir trabajando en la agricultura.

El sueño es pode darle los estudios a los hijos para que sean profesionales.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los hijos.
texts.en:
Luisa del Rosario, 43, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas, in the province of Bolívar.  She is a member of 26 de Noviembre Communal Bank, located in the district of Blancas, in Ventanas Canton.  This bank is dedicated to ranching and agricultural jobs.

Luisa del Rosario works growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  She is requesting the loan to buy urea, seeds, insecticide, and weed killer.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs to continue working in agriculture.

Her dream is to be able to give her children an education so they can be professionals.  In her free time she likes to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, insecticide, and weed killer.

loans.name: Evgenia

texts.ru:
Евгения замужем. У нее две дочки. Евгения имеет собственный бизнес.

Евгения имеет свою торговую точку  на центральном рынке города. Она продает женскую одежду: тенниски,футболки, юбки и брюки. Опыт работы Евгении 12 лет. Она трудолюбивая и ответственная.  

Евгения просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 6000 гривен на закупку сезонного товара - одежды и обуви . Кредит поможет ей увеличить прибыль и тем самым улучшить быт семьи.
texts.en:
Evgenia is married and has two daughters. She operates her own business: at a retail spot located within the city's central market, she sells women's clothing - shirts, T-shirts, skirts and trousers. Evgenia has 12 years of experience in this area. She is a hard-working and responsible person.

Evgenia is requesting a loan of 6000 hryvnia to purchase seasonal merchandise, such as clothing and footwear. This loan will help Evgenia increase her profits and thereby improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing and footwear

loans.name: Union De Cabecera Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Unión de Cabecera” está conformado por 10 mujeres que son muy trabajadoras y responsables; viven en un pueblito muy pequeño que lleva por nombre Cabecera, lugar donde las personas son muy humildes y sencillas. El nombre lo eligieron los integrantes ya que se consideran un grupo unido y también por el lugar en donde viven. 

María Josefa o Doña Jose, como le dicen de cariño, es integrante del grupo; tiene 37 años de edad y está casada desde hace 13 años con el señor Fernando quien trabaja de mecánico. Juntos han formado una familia con dos niños los cuales estudian. Doña Jose platica que ya había estado en el grupo aunque salió por un tiempo, pero nuevamente vuelve a integrarse él. Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 2 cerdos y comenta que si le sobra un poco de dinero comprará block y lámina para hacer un corral ya que por el momento no tiene un lugar destinado para los animalitos. Cuenta que aunque es la primera vez que criará cerdos, está muy contenta de iniciar con la actividad ya que desea ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su única dificultad es que por el momento no tiene un chiquero para instalar a los puercos pero espera que con el crédito pueda construirlo. Para Doña Jose, una de sus metas es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida; le gustaría que sus hijos terminaran de estudiar una carrera. Sus ganancias le ayudarán significativamente ya que podrá ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, la educación de sus hijos, entre otras cosas. 

El grupo "Unión de Cabecera" está conformado por: Silvia, María Imelda y Ángela quienes invertirán en sus tiendas de abarrotes; Flora comprara pollos y guajolotes (palabra más usada para referirse a los pavos) para cría y venta; Juan comprara borregos también para cría y venta; Victoria invertirá en papelería y Ma Concepción y Sandra invertirán en pollos para cría y venta. Finalmente, Doña Manuela comprará puerquitos y elotes preparados para venta. Todos los integrantes están muy agradecidas con Vision Fund (FRAC) y KIVA por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The group “Unión de Cabecera” consists of 10 hardworking and responsible members. They live in a very small town called Cabecera, a place where the people are humble and modest. The name was chosen by the members because they consider themselves to be a unified group and they also included the place where they live.

María Josefa, or Doña Jose as she is affectionately called, is a member of this group. She is 37 years old and has been married for 13 years to Sr. Fernando, who works as a mechanic. They formed a family that includes two children who are in school. Doña Jose explains that she was with the group, left for a while, and then returned and rejoined the group. This time she is requesting a loan in order to buy two pigs. She says that if she had a little extra money, she would buy blocks and sheets of lumber for building a pen since has no place to keep the animals at the moment. Doña Jose says that this is the first time she will be raising pigs, so she is very pleased to be starting this activity because she wants to help her husband with the household expenses. Her only difficulty at the moment is that she does not have a pen to hold the pigs, but she hopes to get a loan in order to build one. For Doña Jose, one of her goals is to see her children finish their studies so that they can have better opportunities in life. She would like to see them study for a degree. Her earnings will be a significant help with the household expenses, her children's education, and other things.

The group “Unión de Cabecera” also includes the following members: • Silvia, María Imelda, and Ángela will invest in their grocery stores. • Flora will buy chickens and turkeys to raise and sell. • Juan will buy sheep to raise and sell. • Victoria will invest in stationery. • Ma Concepción and Sandra will invest in chickens to raise and sell. • Doña Manuela will buy pork cutlets and corn on the cob to prepare and sell. All of the members are extremely grateful to Vision Fund (FRAC) and to Kiva for providing this loan.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Las Martínez Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Martínez y está conformado por cuatro mujeres con deseos de superación.

Una de las integrantes es la señorita Nathaly Soledad, mejor conocida como Nathaly, de 19 años de edad quien se dedica a la serigrafía (estampados  para playeras). Nathaly dice que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es hacer los diseños de los estampados, ya que pone en práctica lo que más le gusta que es la creatividad. Afortunadamente, realiza su trabajo desde casa, aunque uno de sus sueños es tener un local y darse a conocer por su trabajo y empeño en sus estampados. Nathaly menciona que las características que debe tener una persona  para hacer el trabajo que ella desempeña es saber rotular, tener creatividad y ser amable con los clientes para que ellos mismos la recomienden. Además, Nathaly se considera una persona especial por su empaño para que los proyectos tengan la mejor calidad y sobre todo por que tiene la ilusión de superarse y mejorar su negocio. Nathaly pidió un crédito para comprar más pinturas para rotular, máquinas para coser y una computadora para hacer sus diseños.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:

Cecilia Nohemi - se dedica a la venta de manualidades.
Yaneth Lourdes - se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo.
Merab Aide - se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo.

Le dan las gracias Vision Found por ayudar a los jóvenes que desean tener su negocio y con el tiempo engrandecerlo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Martinez," and it is made up of 4 women who have a desire to succeed.  

One of the members is Nathaly Soledad, better known as Nathaly.  She is 19 years old and has a silk-screen business (putting designs on T-shirts).  Nathaly says that what she likes about her job is making the designs for the prints, because it allows her to put her creativity into practice, which she enjoys.  Fortunately, she is able to do her work from her house, although one of her dreams is to have her own store and become well-known for her work and the care she puts into her prints.  Nathaly mentions that the characteristics that a person needs to do this type of job include: knowing how to letter, having creativity, and being friendly to the customers so that they will also recommend your business to others.  Also, Nathaly is considered to be a special person for the effort she puts into her projects so that they will be of the best quality, and most of all for her hopes of improving and excelling with her business.  Nathaly asked for a loan to buy more paints for lettering, sewing machines and a computer to make her designs.  The other members of the group are: Cecelia Nohemi, who sells hand-made items, Yaneth Lourdes, who sells shoes through a catalog, and Merab Aide, who also sells shoes through a catalog.  They thank the Vision Foundation for helping the young people who want to have their own businesses and expand them over time.

loans.use: to buy silk-screen printing supplies

loans.name: Vandy's Group

texts.en: Vandy, 44, is a mother of eight children and lives in a rural area of Thmor Koul district, Battambang Province. To earn a living for her big family, she and her husband have been farming on four hectares of farmland for 12 years. However, the lack of working capital to plow the farmland and buy fertilizer remain the main challenges for her family. Vandy has been with VisionFund since 2011 and successfully repaid a previous loan. The loan has enabled her to improve her living standard and to buy a mini tractor for plowing her rice farm. She now is applying for new loan with VisionFund with her group member who has been with VisionFund for four cycles. As the group leader, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of KHR 1,400,000 and she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer (KHR 600,000) and hire a laborer to to plow her farmland (KHR 800,000). She hopes to receive a high crop yield and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire a laborer for plowing the farm.

loans.name: Kenjekul

texts.ru:
Кенжекул – участник группы «Актан», ей 33 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Кенжекул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи 13 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  хозяйство Кенжекул приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц. Также, Кенжекул занимается выращиванием и перепродажей груш и яблок.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кенжекул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Кенжекул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Kenjekul is member of the Aktan group. She is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. 13 years ago, Kenjekul started raising livestock and growing crops, thereby providing the main source of income for her family. After launching her business with a 20,000 som (KGS) investment, Kenjekul presently earns roughly 12,000 som per month. She also grows and sells pears and apples.

In order to continue developing her business, Kenjekul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase young livestock. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fredesvinda Elisa

texts.es:
Fedesvinda vive en la calurosa ciudad e Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso y es una ciudad en la cual se pueden visitar muchos atractivos turísticos como las Líneas de Nazca, las pirámides de Cahuachi, el cementerio de Chauchilla, los acueductos de Cantalloc, entre otros, en los cuales podemos admirar lo grandioso de la cultura Nazca y en los que podemos despejarnos. Fredesvinda es madre de 5 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 37, 33, 33 (gemelos),24 y 15.  Fredesvinda ha sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos sola ya que el padre de sus hijos la abandono y desde ese momento se convirtió en madre para sus hijos y por los cuales ella ha trabajo y sigue trabajando en especial por su menor hijo para darle una vida digna y que sea una persona de bien ya que los mayores ya están encaminados. Cuando Fredesvinda tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Seco de Res” y en ocasiones le gusta leer en especial los periódicos para poder saber lo que pasa en su ciudad. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo estudio hasta el primer grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado terminar la escuela.

Día a día a Fredesvinda trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras en el campo ferial de su ciudad, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender diariamente alrededor de 15 clientes; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque  es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece  productos de calidad y precios cómodos.

Fredesvindad está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comparar mercadería para su negocio como zapallo al por mayor, tuna, papa, cebolla, camote, queso, entre otros; así de esta manera ella podrá tener  mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir creciendo y luchar cada da para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Sembrar en la pequeña parcela que posee y y ser una comerciante mayorista”.
texts.en:
Fedesvinda lives in the warm city of Nazca.  The city is known for having a warm climate, and it is a city where you can visit lots of tourist attractions like the Nazca Lines [extensive hieroglyphics that according to some studies were used by the ancient Nazca culture as an astronomical calendar], the Cahuachi Pyramids, the Chauchilla Cemetary, and the Cantalloc Aquaducts.  These attractions, among others, allow us to admire and enjoy the magnificent Nazca culture.

Fredesvina has five children, ages 37, 33, 33, (twins), 24, and 15.  Fredesvina has known how to get her children ahead by herself.  This is because the father of her children abandoned her.  From that moment on she was mother and father to her children.  It is for them that she has worked and continues working.  She does this especially for her youngest child in order to give him a decent life and so that he becomes a good person.  The older children have already started their own lives.

When Fredesvinda has free time she really likes to eat one of her favorite dishes “Seco de Res” [beef stew], which is delicious.  Sometimes she likes to read, especially the newpapers in order to be able to know what is happening in her city.  Due to her parents’ small amount of financial resources, she only went to school until the first year of high school.  However, she would have liked to finish school.

From day to day Fredesvinda works in her business selling vegetables at the fair grounds in her city.  She works around ten hours a day in her business, and she is able to tend to around 15 customers.  She believes that it is going well for her in her business because she is very kind to the customers, she offers quality products, and she has affordable prices.

Fredesvindad is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy things like wholesale pumpkin, prickly pears, potatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and cheese, among others.

This way she will be able to have a greater variety of products and improve her income.  This will allow her to continue growing and laboring every day to be able to make her biggest dream come true:  “To plant on the small parcel that she has and to be a wholesale merchant.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise like wholesale pumpkin, prickly pears, potatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and cheese, among others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergents and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hot dogs to sell.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon is from the Prey Chor district of Kompong, Cham province. She is 57 years old, widowed, and has a married child. Chuon lives with her daughter and her son-in-law in a house since her husband passed away. She is hard-working woman who pays full attention to her rice farming business to earn income. She also buys and collects palm leaves for a weaving business and transports her finished products to the marketplace. 

Due to the lack of the family-owned vehicle, Chuon has encountered difficulties in transporting her products. She is asking for a loan of KHR 500,000 to purchase a used motorcycle to support her business as well as for personal use. She hopes to receive this loan as her fifth cycle loan. She is an honest client of HKL and she already paid off her previous loans successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle to support her business as well as for personal use.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замира – участник группы «Актан», ей 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Замира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи 15 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  хозяйство Замиры приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Замира  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Zamira is a member of the Aktan group. She is 39 years old, married, and is raising 3 children. 15 years ago, Zamira began raising livestock and growing crops as the main source of income for her family. After launching her business with an investment of 50,000 som (KGS), she presently earns around 12,000 som per month from sales of milk and dairy products.

In order to continue developing her business, Zamira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase young livestock. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
This is Solidad, 60, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.   
                          
Solidad operates a cellphone accessories retail business. What she basically does is buy accessory items from wholesalers and sells them per piece/pack with a profit. Products are cell phone accessories like head phones, cell phone holders and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling price and the many options she offers. She also offers perfumes and wallets in her store.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of cellphone accessory products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Solidad dreams of having her own permanent place where she can put up her store. She hopes to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of cellphone accessories and products needed in her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 40 years old and is married. She takes good care of her seven school-aged children. 

Judith owns a multi-cab to transport passengers. The multi-cab has the capacity to carry 12-14 persons to certain destinations. Over three years, Judith's  good management has made her stand out. At the end of the month, she gets PHP 2,000 which she uses for day-to-day expenditures and other wants as well.
