La señora Gelcia es socia del banco comunal “Dulce vida II” del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Lleva trabajando cuatro años con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y su negocio se ubica en un espacio dendtro de su propia casa porque se ubica en una avenida principal.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 cajas de cerveza, 7 cajas de gaseosas de diferentes sabores, 1 paquete de sorbete, 2 docenas de vasos, 1 paquete de agua mineral.
Su hijo le ayuda en su negocio cuando tiene que acomodar las bebidas y también en la atención a los clientes, su esposo es empleado público. 
Está agradecida con Manuela Ramos por los cuatro años que viene trabajando con ella.
texts.en:
Gelcia is a member of the communal bank "Dulce Vida II" in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali.  She is 47, married and has two children.

For four years she has been working with loans through Manuela Ramos.  She sells sodas out of a space in her own house, which is on the main avenue.

With the new loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN, she will buy: 10 cases of beer, seven cases of different flavored soda, one package of sorbet, two dozen cups, and one package of mineral water.

Her son helps her handle the beverages and with customer service.  Her husband is a public employee.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the four years she has been working with her.

loans.use: To buy sodas, beer and cups.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional clothing stock to resell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 43 years old and married to Florence. He has been blessed with three children.  

Joel is a cobbler and has been running this business for the last three years. His monthly income is KES 2,500.

He is requesting his first loan of KES 10,000 through the Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). This loan will assist him in purchasing more shoe brushes, polishes, spare soles, and other associated items for his work. He plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest and increase his inventory. 

Joel's future dream is to have a stable business and income that will help him to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more shoe brushes, polishes, and spare soles

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, a resident of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, She is 41 years old, married, and blessed with two children. Her husband is a public vehicle driver for a transportation service.

Juliet owns and operates a transportation service. Juliet owns a two-wheeled motorcycle, which she uses as transportation to earn a living. Juliet's service has the capacity to transport up to four passengers to their chosen routes. Each month, Juliet is earning approximately PHP 4,500.

The previous loan taken by Juliet, which was intended for her three-wheeled motorcycle, was very successful. She was able to repay her loan adequately.

Juliet has once again joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase a headlight and other spare parts for better service. When she gets enough funds, she will buy a vacant lot for farming in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase a motor headlight and other spare parts for better service

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Grace has been working hard to manage her silver fish-selling business. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings through BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more silver fish to sell, and will help Grace to generate greater profits by purchasing more items to sell. Grace hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand the business further. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To purchase more silver fish to sell

loans.name: Sarem's Group

texts.en:
One of the residents in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Sarem is 34 years old and has been blessed with three children. Of her three children, two of them are under her responsibility as they are still in school. For the sake of her family, Sarem grows corn on five hectares of farmland. She has been with this business for 13 years. However, she is able to save only 5,000 KHR per day. 

This is Sarem's first loan with VisionFund Cambodia. She has formed a group consisting of other two members to request a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy seed and fertilizer for her cornfield. She hopes to grow her corn healthfully to multiply her income so that she can provide proper food for her family.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for her cornfield

loans.name: Anzor

texts.en:
Anzor is from the village of Akhalsopeli in the Kakheti region of East Georgia. He is 63 years old and lives with his 16-year-old son and two grandchildren of 11 and eight years. Anzor’s grandchildren go to school. Anzor has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to fund the start-up of his agricultural business without any success. His loan requests were rejected each time due to his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The family's only source of income of the family is Anzor's monthly salary. He is an agricultural worker in the village. The family's monthly income doesn’t exceed 200 GEL, or approximately 120 USD. It is hardly enough to feed a four-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence-poor category. 

Anzor is requesting this loan through Credo to start a pig farm. His loan request was approved in the frames of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

With the loan, Anzor will purchase piglets and feed. He will place his piglets in an old empty pig farm located in his yard. Anzor will work hard in the farm and, after 6 months, he will be able to sell first piglets. The new business initiative, financed with the loan, will significantly increase the income of his family. Anzor will be able to create better living conditions for his son and grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Janvier

texts.fr:
Janvier est né au Rwanda et il a 30 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 9 mois à 9 ans, dont 2 enfants scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.
Janvier est commerçant. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 40 l d’huile, 5 sacs de farine de maïs, 3 sacs du riz, 25kgs du sucre, acheter les pièces de rechange de vélos, 2 portes et 3 fenêtres pour son commerce.
Pour faire croitre son commerce il planifie de solliciter d’autres crédit pour son commerce et augmenter les produits à vendre. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  être grossiste et faire le commerce en dehors du pays . Avec les profits, il prévoit de faire le finissage de sa maison d’habitation et payer les frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Janvier was born in Rwanda and is 30 years of age. He is married with five children aged from 9 months to 9 years, and two of his children go to school. He himself has five years of primary school education.

Janvier is a retailer, and this is his first loan with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy 40 liters of oil, five bags of corn flour, three bags of rice, 25 kilos of sugar, bicycle spare parts, two doors and three windows for his store. 

To increase his business he plans to request other loans and increase the products he sells. Over the coming years he would like to become a wholesaler and trade outside of Rwanda. Janvier plans to use his profits to complete his home and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: To buy 40 liters of oil, five bags of corn flour, three bags of rice, 25 kilos of sugar, bicycle spare parts, two doors and three windows for his store.

loans.name: Puissance De Philibert 3, 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Judith est la coordinatrice de son groupe Puissance de Philibert. Elle habite dans la région de Trou-du-Nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de vente de charbon pendant les 6 dernières années.

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le charbon. Des autres membres Du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires, cosmétiques, vêtements, chaussureset du charbon.

Judith dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause du chômage. et certains n'ont pas beaucoup d'argent pour acheter des choses dont ils ont besoin.
texts.en:
Judith is the coordinator of the Puissance de Philibert group. She lives in the Trou-du-Nord region of Haïti where electricity is rare and water limited. She has been running her charcoal-selling business for the past six years.

She would like to use this loan to invest in charcoal. The other members of the group need loans for businesses such as selling groceries, cosmetics, clothes, shoes and charcoal.

Judith says that her main challenge is the lack of steadfast buyers as a result of unemployment; some people do not have enough money to buy things they need.

loans.use: to invest in charcoal.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.fr:
Vincent est né au Rwanda et il a 26 ans, il est marie avec 1 enfant de 1an. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.
Vincent est commerçant. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 2 camions de briques, 20 arbres, 1 camions de sable, 2 portes et 3 fenêtres pour construire sa maison d’habitation.
Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  construire des maisons destine à louer. Vincent fait le transport de taxi moto.
texts.en:
Vincent was born in Rwanda and is 26 years old. He is married with a one-year old child. He has five years of primary education. 

Vincent is a trader and this is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy two lorry loads of bricks, 20 trees, one lorry load of sand, two doors and three windows, so he can build his own house. In the coming years he would like to build houses to rent out. He has a motor-bike taxi activity.

loans.use: to buy two lorry loads of bricks, 20 trees, one lorry load of sand, two doors and three windows to build his own house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of drinks.

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye est une femme célibataire qui a divorcé avec son premier mari il y'a de cela un an.Elle n'a pas d'enfant et vit dans la grande maison familiale avec ses deux parents et ses frères et sœurs.Après avoir appris pendant trois ans la couture, elle a ouvert son atelier au marché de sa ville.Elle y a en même temps implanté une boutique de vente de produits de mercerie et de tissus divers ainsi qu'un réfrigérateur pour vendre des crèmes glacées.Ces deux activités lui permettent de subvenir  à ses besoins mais aussi de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de  la famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce pour préparer la période des fêtes, elle sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des tissus et des produits de mercerie.Son ambition et d'ouvrir une grande boutique de vente de issus et d'articles de mercerie.
texts.en: Ndèye is a single woman who was divorced from her first husband a year ago. She does not have any children and lives in a large family house with her two parents and brothers and sisters. Having learnt the sewing trade for three years, she opened a workshop in the market in her town. At the same time she set up a shop there for the sale of haberdashery products and various fabrics, as well as a refrigerator to sell ice-creams. These two activities enable her to provide for her own needs but also to help out with the family's expenses. With a view to increasing her working capital to prepare for the festival season, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy fabrics and haberdashery products. Her ambition is to open a large shop to sell fabrics and haberdashery products.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery products

loans.name: Sebastienne Eugenie

texts.fr: Sebastienne est une jeune femme de 31 ans,fiancée et mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 05 et 15 ans.elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans où elle vend du piment.La petitesse de son capital l'oblige souvent à acheter un filet de piments pour détailler ce qui crée souvent des ruptures de stock et l'empêche de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle qui est de plus en plus grandissante car elle est obligé d'écouler tout le stock avant de pouvoir le renouveller et d'avoir un bénéfice considérable.Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de filets(03) ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle, d'augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent son bénéfice.Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et économisera l'autre pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sebastienne Eugenie is a young, 31-year-old, woman. She is engaged and is the mother of 3 children, aged between 5 and 15 years. She has been a retailer of peppers in a local market for 10 years. Her small amount of capital often limits her to buying one net of peppers, which frequently leaves her with a lack of inventory and prevents her from being able to properly satisfy the demands of her growing clientèle, as she is forced to sell off her entire stock before being able to renew it and make a significant profit.

She is therefore requesting this loan so that she can buy 3 nets of peppers, which will enable her to satisfy her customers, increase her sales and consequently, her profits. She plans to reinvest part of those profits into her business, and will save the rest for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 3 nets of peppers.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, es socia del banco comunal “Dulce Vida” del Distrito de Coronel portillo, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos, todos mayores y con familia.
Se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado numero uno de la ciudad, desde muy temprano acude a su trabajo para cocinar.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 cucharones, 3 espátulas, 3 tenedores, 3 cucharas grandes, 1 juego de coladores, 1 exprimidor de limón, 2 ralladores,   utensilios de cocina por que ya están muy usados y por higiene tiene que hacerlo.
Isabel nos cuenta que le gusta su trabajo porque la mantiene ocupada y le genera los ingresos que necesita, su esposo trabaja en una Empresa privada fuera de la zonas, y regresa a casa algunos días.

Está contenta por el apoyo que tiene de parte de Manuela Ramos para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the “Dulce Vida” communal bank in the Coronel Portillo district, departament of Ucayali. She is 44 years old, married and has 7 children. All of them are grown and have their own families. 

She sells food in the number one market in town. She goes to work very early to cook. 

With her new loan of S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles she will buy: 3 ladles, 3 spatulas, 3 forks, 3 large spoons, 2 set of strainers, 1 lemon squeezer, and 2 graters. The ones that she has have been used a lot and for hygiene she has to buy new ones.

Isabel tells us that she likes her work because it keeps her busy and generates needed income. Her husband works at a private business outside of the area. He comes home for a few days. 

She is happy with the suuport from Manuela Ramos to keep growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est un homme marié , père de trois enfants.Il tient une boutique de vente de produits ménagers tels que des ustensiles de cuisine, des chaises et d'autres articles divers.Il utilise ses revenus pour l'entretien de sa famille et pour la satisfaction de ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des produits ménagers divers.
texts.en: Abdulaye is a married man and father to three children. He has a shop selling various household products, such as kitchen utensils, chairs and various other items. He uses his income to look after his family and to satisfy his own needs. In order to expand his business, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy a variety of household products.

loans.use: to buy various household products.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 36 years old and married to Florence who runs a milk shop for additional income.  Together they have been blessed with five children.  Patrick is a welder and has been running the business for the last five years. His monthly income is KES. 8500.

Patrick is servicing his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET and this will assist him in purchasing more gadgets, spare goods and associated items for his workshop. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest and increase his inventory. His future dream is to have a stable business and income that will help him improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more gadgets, spare goods and associated items for his workshop.

loans.name: Pape Bougouma

texts.fr: Pape est un jeune célibataire sans enfant.Il tient depuis trois ans une boutique de vente de denrées alimentaires dans sa localité.Cette boutique lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses propres besoins mais également de participer aux dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500 000 f pour acheter du riz, du sucre, de l'huile et divers denrées alimentaires.Il ambitionne d'ouvrir une seconde boutique .
texts.en: Pape Bougouma is a young, single man with no children. He has run a grocery shop in his neighbourhood for 3 years. The shop generates a fairly regular stream of income, which allows him to take care of his own needs, as well as enabling him to contribute towards his family's maintenance costs. In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs so that he can buy rice, sugar, oil and various other food products. He aims to open a second shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and various other food products.

loans.name: Fabian Augusto

texts.es:
FABIAN AUGUSTO tiene 50 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y la esposa en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

 FABIAN AUGUSTO el trabaja cómo guardia de seguridad en una empresa. Solicita el crédito para comprar una cosina, microondas, refrigerador.

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar los artefactos que le hacen mucha falta.

Las compras lo hará en guaranda. El sueño es poder salir adelante y tenber mucha salud. en el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia y hacer un poco de deporte.
texts.en:
FABIAN AUGUSTO is 50 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in Guaranda, Bolivar province. 

 FABIAN AUGUSTO works as a security guard at a business. He is asking for the loan to buy a stove, a microwave and a refrigerator. 

With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy the appliances that he really needs. 

He will make his purchases in Guaranda. His dream is to be able to get ahead and be very healthy. In his free time he likes to be with his family and play sports.

loans.use: to buy a stove, a microwave, and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ruben Patricio

texts.es:
RUBEN PATRICIO tiene 30 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar.
RUBEN PATRICIO es chofer en una empresa de transporte. Solicita el crédito para comprar medicina y pago de consulta. Con la ayuda del crédito podra realizarce el chequeo médico.

La consulta la realizará con un médico especialista en guaranda. El sueño es estar con salud para seguir trabajando. en el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
RUBEN PATRICIO is 30 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in Guaranda, Bolivar province.
RUBEN PATRICIO is a driver at a transportation company. He is asking for the loan to buy medicince and to pay for a doctor's visit. With the help of the loan, he will be able to be seen by a doctor.

The appointment will be with a medical specialist in Guaranda. His dream is be healthy and to keep working. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy medicine and to pay for a doctor's visit.

loans.name: Gpf Taiba Group

texts.fr:
L e GPF  Taïba regroupe 5 femmes  qui appartiennent à la même famille. Leur activité consiste à faire du commerce.
Leur présidente, la dame  Khady  s’active dans la vente de prêt à porter depuis 5 ans. Elle possède une cantine non loin de chez elle. Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19 h. Khady est divorcée et gère sa petite famille. 
Comme projet,  elle veut ouvrir une quincaillerie.
texts.en:
The "GPF Taïba" association groups together 5 women who are related. They are all retailers.

The association's leader, Khady, has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for 5 years. She owns a small stall at the market, not far from where she lives. Her workdays start at 8 o'clock in the morning and end at 7 o'clock in the evening. Khady is divorced and is the head of her small family's household. She plans one day to open a hardware store.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: María, originaria de Granada, madre de dos hijos de 17 y 16 años de edad de los cuales uno esta estudiando la secundaria y el otro se dedica a vender junto con ella. Se dedica al comercio vende pasteles, churros de queso, plátanos tostados. Su familia es de origen muy humilde donde todos tienen que trabajar para poder salir adelante. Antes María trabajaba como domestica pero decidió que hora de poner su propio negocio donde pudiera mejorar los ingresos para su hogar a pesar de que ella no pudo estudiar por la limitación económica, ella busca la manera de que al menos uno de sus hijos logre estudiar. Fue por medio de un financiamiento que le dio una institución fue que comenzó a vender sus productos de manera ambulante sale desde tempranas horas a recorrer las calles y barrios de la ciudad regresando por las tardes después de un día de duro trabajo para comenzar a preparar sus plátanos tostados y churros de queso para la venta del  siguiente día.  Ella solicita el crédito para comprar harina, huevo, azúcar, aceite, plátanos y queso pues son la principal materia prima que utiliza para preparar sus productos. Este crédito le permitirá comprar materia prima al por mayor ,más barata y poder producir más. Uno de sus grandes anhelos es lograr componer su casa la cual necesita mejoras y brindarles un techo digno a sus hijos y tener un mejor lugar para poner su puesto de venta de churros de queso y plátanos tostados.
texts.en:
María is originally from Granada.  She is the mother of two children who are 17 and 16 years old.  One of her children is in high school and the other works with her.  María's business is selling cakes, cheese churros and plantain chips.  Her family is of very humble origins and everybody has to work in order to get ahead in life.  María used to work as a domestic but she decided to set up her own business which would allow her to increase her household income in spite the fact that she wasn't able to attend school for financial reasons.  She is looking for a way to ensure that at least one of her children is able to study.  It was through a loan from the institution that she started selling her products as an itinerant vendor.  She goes out early each morning to walk through the city streets and neighborhoods, returning home in the evening after a hard day's work to start preparing her plantain chips and cheese churros to sell the following day.

María is requesting this loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar, oil, plantains and cheese as these are the main supplies she uses in preparing her products.  This loan will allow her to buy supplies wholesale.  This works out cheaper and enables her to produce more.  One of her greatest wishes is to be able to repair her house, as it needs some improvements, and to provide her children with a decent home.  She would also like to have a better place to set up her sales stall and sell her cheese churros and plantain chips.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, oil, plantains and cheese

loans.name: Zoila Argentina

texts.es: Zoila , habita en Granada una de las ciudades más turísticas de Nicaragua. Es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de los cuales solo una está a su cargo ya que el otro es independiente. Ella se dedica a la costura, esta actividad la aprendió de su mama la cual era una mujer muy humilde que necesitaba salir adelante Zoila nos cuenta que ella junto con su hermana tuvieron que trabajar desde muy joven para poder comer. Esto la ayudo a ella a sobrevivir y poder darle estudios a sus hijos , lleva más de 20 años dedicándose a la costura. Cada pieza que ella elabora la vende en el mercado tanto de la ciudad y en la capital su hija mayor la acompaña a vender. Su proyecto de vida es ofrecer variedad de piezas hechas por sus manos, producir más de lo que actualmente vende pero necesita más materia prima para trabajar es por tal motivo que solicita el crédito para comprar al por mayor tela , hilos, encajes , botones.
texts.en:
Zoila lives in Granada, one of the most popular tourist cities in Nicaragua.  She is the single mother of two children, only one of whom is still in her care.  Her business is sewing.  She learned from her mom who was a very humble woman who needed to provide for her family.  Zoila tells us that she and her sister had to work from a very young age in order to eat.  This helped her to survive and provide her children with an education.  Zoila has been sewing for more than 20 years.  She sells every item that she makes either in the market in her city or in the capital city.  Her eldest daughter goes with her when she goes to sell her products. 

Zoila's life goal is to sell a variety of items that she has made herself and to produce more than she currently sells.  However, she needs more raw materials in order to work.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, lace and buttons wholesale.s.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace and buttons wholesale

loans.name: Michel Silvana

texts.es: Michel , casada , 27 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad. Ella es de oficio comerciante ella tiene una pequeña pulpería y también trabaja con su padre en la elaboración y venta de fajas, billeteras y botas de cuero su producto están demandado que vienen de todas partes del país a comprar incluso los mismos turistas la buscan . Este negocio lo empezó su papa pero por la edad ya no pudo seguir asi que ella tuvo que hacerse cargo pero siempre contando con la supervisión de su padre por la experiencia que tiene para trabajar el cuero. Adicionalmente con lo poco que ha ido ahorrando a puesto una mini pulpería que le ayuda a generar ingresos cuando la venta de fajas y botas esta baja. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta el progreso. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar materia prima para elaborar fajas y botas y comprar granos básicos para surtir su pulpería. Ella desea hacer rentable tanto su negocio de venta de fajas, botas de cuero de igual manera su pulpería para ofrecer productos de consumo familiar para la gente de su pueblo.
texts.en: Michel is married and 27 years old. She has two children who are 2 and 3 years old. She is a businesswoman by trade. She has a small grocery store and also works with her father making and selling leather belts, wallets, and boots. Her product is in demand since people come from all over the country to buy, and even the tourists look for her. Her father started this business, but due to his age, he could not continue. She had to take charge, but always with her father's supervision because of the experience he has in working with leather. Additionally, with the little bit that she has been saving she has installed a small grocery store that helps her to earn income when sales of belts and boots are low. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who likes progress. She needs the loan to buy raw materials to make belts and boots, and to buy bulk grains to stock her grocery store. She wants to make her business selling leather belts and boots profitable, and her grocery store as well, in order to offer products for household consumption for the people of her town.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make belts and boots, and to buy bulk grains

loans.name: Gpf Taiba 2 Group

texts.fr:
C’est un groupe de crédit qui regroupe des membres d’une même famille. Elles l’ont nommé GPF Taiba 2. Elles font de la vente d’habits prêts à porter. Elles ont pris comme responsable, la dame Haby  qui a une expérience de 3 ans dans ce domaine. Avec le crédit, elle augmente son stock de marchandises. Elle appui son mari dans les charges de la maison.
Elle prévoit même  avec l’appui des financiers d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de produits divers pour élargir sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of this group are part of the same family, and they named their group GPF Taiba 2. They sell ready-to-wear clothing.

Mrs. Haby was chosen to be responsible for the group. She has three years of experience in this field.

With her part of the loan, she will increase her stock of products. She helps her husband with the household expenses.

Thanks to the lenders, she even foresees opening a shop to sell various products and expand her clientele.

loans.use: to buy read-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Tineere Group

texts.fr:
Mme CLEMENTINE est la représentante du groupe TINEERE. Elle va bien ainsi que tout le groupe, elle a fait son mariage religieux. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 04ans le moins âgé a 02ans. Personne ne  va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes à sa charge.
Mme est restauratrice (vend du riz). Elle exerce ce métier depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de Toecin. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Mme veut  s’acheter un sac d’arachide pour transformer en patte d’arachide  pour la préparation de la sauce du riz et 02 sacs de riz.
Elle  utilise ses bénéfices pour s’occuper de sa famille. Pour le prêt passer, elle a pu acheter ce quelle a prévu et a réaliser un bénéfice, elle est très contente. Pour ce prêt, elle espère augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir un restaurant.
texts.en: Mrs CLEMENTINE is the representative of the TINEERE group. She is married and a mother of two children aged 2 and 4 years old, neither of which attend school. She is also caring for 2 other persons. For the past three years she has been selling rice dishes as a restaurateur. She stocks up on products at the market in Toecin and sells to both male and female customers. She is asking for this loan to purchase two bags of rice and one bag of groundnut, which she will make into peanut paste as a sauce for the rice. All profits are spent on taking care of her family. She was very satisfied with the previous loan she received and hopes this second loan will allow her to make even more profits. She dreams to one day own a restaurant.

loans.use: purchase two bags of rice and one bag of groundnut to make into peanute paste to use in the preparation of sauce for rice

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal ”El Paraíso” del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 41 años y tres hijos, solo dos están a su cargo.
Recién hace un año que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a brindar servicio de masajes corporales, recién está acondicionando su casa para poder dar mejor atención.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 cremas para el cuerpo, 3 litros de aceite de coco, 1 docena de toallas, 3cremas para las manos, 2 cremas para los pies, 3 frascos de talco.
Todo lo está comprando de poquito para cuando habrá su local este bien implementado por que ya no quiere a tender a domicilio sino que sus clientes acudan a su local, espera que le sigan prestando el dinero y de esa manera hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the ”El Paraíso” community bank which is located in Coronel Portillo district, in Ucayali department.  She is 41 years old and has three children, only two of whom are in her care.

María has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her business is providing body massages.  She has recently been fitting out her house so that she can provide a better service.

With her new loan for 1,500 soles, María will buy: 3 lots of body cream, 3 liters of coconut oil, one dozen towels, 3 lots of hand cream, two lots of foot cream and 3 bottles of talc.

She is buying everything gradually and looks forward to having well-equipped premises because she no longer wants to serve her customers in her home.  She would rather her customers came to her premises.  She hopes to continue receiving loans so that she can grow her business.

loans.use: to buy creams, oils, talc, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Windingoudi Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZALISSA est la représentante du groupe WINDIN GOUDI. Elle se porte très bien ainsi que sa famille. Mme a pu acheter son matériel de couture et est très contente car le prêt l’a beaucoup aidé. Elle renouvelle son crédit et espère que tout va encore bien se passer Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.
Mme est couturière. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de Toecin, Bissighin et au secteur 22. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Mme veut  s’acheter 02 rouleau de popeline ; des doubles cols, tissus satin, 01 paquet de fermeture et autres accessoires.
 Elle veut  épargner un peu ses bénéfices et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Mme ambitionne  acheter une machine à broder pour son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zalissa is the representative of WINDIN GOUDI Group. She's faring well, and so does her family. She was able to buy sewing supplies and is very happy because the loan helped her very much. She's now seeking a new loan and hopes that everything will go well once again.

She's married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 10 and the youngest is 4 years old. Both go to school, and she has three persons in her care.

Mrs. Zalissa has been a seamstress for fifteen years. She gets her supplies at the markets Toecin, Bissighin and Sector 22. Her customers and women and men.

She wants to purchase two rolls of poplin, some double collars, satin fabric, one pack of zippers, and other accessories.

She wants to put some of her profits away and improve the living standard of her family. She ambitions to buy an embroidery machine for her business.

loans.use: to buy two rolls of poplin, some double collars, satin fabric, one pack of zippers, and other accessories

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 35-years-old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 8 children. 
Richard is provides motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the motorcycle services.  Richard has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Richard hopes to improve his services to support education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha reside en la cuarta ciudad con más habitantes del Ecuador, Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo es la capital de la provincia de Santo Domingo que yace sobre la parte montañosa de la costa. La localización de esta ciudad le permite ser el enlace de varias ciudades ecuatorianas haciendo de Santo Domingo un lugar donde abunda el comercio. Santo Domingo tiene un clima tropical y bastante húmedo que varía de 18°C a 28°C.  Santo Domingo es conocido por que es donde viven los Tsáchilas, un grupo indígena que mantiene sus tradiciones tales como vestuario y costumbres desde antes de la época colonial.  
A sus 46 años de edad, Martha está casada y  tiene dos hijos de 19 y 17 años. Su esposo se llama Alex cultiva y vende plátano verde. Hace 4 años Martha comenzó su negocio de vender productos de belleza ambulantemente trabajando seis horas al día. Ella quiere que sus dos negocios familiares salgan adelante. Ha trabajado ya dos años con Fundación Alternativa asistiendo a talleres de capacitación de manejo de negocios. Por lo tanto, solicita un préstamo  Kiva para poder invertir en la compra de cosméticos y en su cultivo de plátanos. De esta manera, se incrementarán sus ventas y podrá tener más ingresos para brindarles un mejor estilo de vida a sus dos hijos y poder brindarles la educación superior que ella nunca tuvo.
texts.en:
Martha resides in Santo Domingo, the fourth largest city in Ecuador. Santo Domingo is the capital of Santo Domingo Province and is situated in the mountainous part of the coast. This city is a center of commerce since it serves as a link to several other Ecuadorian cities. Santo Domingo has a tropical and humid climate that varies between 18°C and 28°C. The city is known as the home of the Tsáchilas, an indigenous group whose members have maintained their traditions, including their clothing and customs that have existed since colonial times.

At 46 years of age, Martha is married and has two children (ages 19 and 17). Her husband is named Alex, who grows and sells green bananas. Four years ago Martha started her business as a traveling vendor, selling beauty products six hours a day. She wants these two family-owned businesses to thrive. Martha has already been working with Fundación Alternativa for two years and has attended workshops related to business management. She is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can invest in the purchase of cosmetics and in her husband’s banana crop. Martha hopes that this will increase her sales and provide more income that will result in a better lifestyle for her two children and provide them with a higher education that she was not able to attain.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell and fertilizers for her husband's banana crop.

loans.name: Christian Jesus

texts.es:
Christian es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pareja y su pequeño hijo de 3 años, a pesar de tan joven Christian es una persona muy responsable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión en compañía de su pareja y su pequeño, y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su pareja, desde hace 2 años, Christian trabaja como obrero en una empresa avícola de su ciudad, donde labora un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, él se encuentra muy a gusto con la labor que realiza ya que lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y trato amable hacia los demás.
Christian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un terreno en el cual desea poder construir su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente vive en casa de sus padres; de esta manera Christian tendrá su casa propia y podrá brindar mayor bienestar, seguridad y comodidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Christian is a 21-year-old man who lives in the city of Chincha together with his partner and 3-year-old son.  In spite of his young age, Christian is a very responsible, hard-working and enthusiastic person who puts all his efforts into providing for his family.  Unfortunately, owing to his need to work and cover his expenses, Christian was not able to study for a degree.  However, he dreams of being able to some day.  In his free time, he enjoys watching television together with his partner and his young son.  He also sometimes cooks delicious 'carapulcra con sopa seca' to share with his family.

Through his own initiative and thanks to his partner's support, Christian has been working for a poultry company in his city for two years.  He works approximately 12 hours a day.  He is very happy with the work that he does.  He is well thought of as a result of his good work and the kind way he treats everybody.

Christian is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a plot of land on which he would like to build his own home as he currently lives in his parents' house.  This will enable Christian to have his own home and he will be able to provide his family with greater security and comfort.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Erlyn Enrique

texts.es: Erlyn , tiene 34 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos de 12 , 10 y 3 años de edad, es originario de Granada y se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de muebles. Actividad que realiza desde los 8 años de edad  cuando su familia comenzó con este negocio. El se fue a trabajar fuera de Nicaragua para lograr ahorrar y comprar sus propias herramientas y maquinaria para iniciar su propio taller. Así lo hizo parte de sus productos lo logra vender fuera de Nicaragua cuando lo visitan turistas en busca de sus creaciones. Su pedido ha ido aumentando y no cuenta con suficiente materia prima para trabajar es por tal motivo que solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos y materia prima tales como pegamento, tornillos, barniz, pintura, para elaborar muebles. Pues su meta es hacer crecer su negocio , pagar su crédito a tiempo y volver a invertir en su negocio ofreciendo variedad y calidad en las piezas de muebles que fabrica.
texts.en: Erlyn is 34 years old and the father of three children who are 12, 10 and 3 years old.  He is from Granada and his business is making and selling furniture.  He has been doing this work since he was 8 years old, when his family started the business.  Erlyn went to work outside of Nicaragua so that he could save up and buy his own tools and machinery in order to set up his own workshop.  He manages to sell some of his products outside of Nicaragua when tourists visit in search of his creations.  His orders have been increasing and he doesn't have enough raw materials with which to work.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy the supplies and raw materials he needs to make his furniture such as adhesive, screws, varnish and paint.  His goals are to grow his business, to repay his loan on time and to re-invest in his business, offering both variety and quality in the pieces of furniture he makes.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials such as adhesive, screws, varnish and paint

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 38-years-old and lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with five children ranging from the age of 8 months to 14-years-old.  Angelita helps her husband in their fishing business that they’ve owned for 14 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy a new fish net. A new one will help them to catch more fish, which will enable them to have a better income for their family. Her profit will take care of her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net

loans.name: Yeyen

texts.en:
Yeyen is a 62-year-old, a mother of 4 children. Her children are school-aged and her husband is a farmer. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.Yeyen is involved in agriculture, specifically harvesting rice to sell locally. She has been in this business for 12 years and this is the primary source of income for the family. Every month, she earns 3000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which is enough to cover day-to-day expenses. 

In 2009, Adelaida joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance to help improve her business activities. She applied for a loan of PHP 7000  from the cooperative to purchase rice manure/fertilizer. She is planning to expand her business area and/or improve her family's living conditions. Yeyen is hoping that her business will flourish and she will be able to improve the life of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice manure/fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Merly

texts.en:
Ma. Merly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her business.

Ma. Merly has been in this business for 33 years. Ma. Merly earns more income from farming vegetables.

Ma. Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all of them go to school. She is taking care of her father. 

Susan has been selling charcoal from home for ten years, retail, working seven days a week. She has no other source of income.

She has applied for a loan of UShs 900,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her major business challenges include transportation. She joined MCDT because old members informed her that the staff is trustworthy.  She aspires to be able to sell wholesale. She lives in her house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from plastic ware retailing.

Mary Jane aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: 29-year-old Geraldine is a married woman with five children between the ages of 1 and 12. She does farming for a living. She primarily grows rice crops to sell and has a monthly income of 4,500 PHP. Geraldine works hard to sustain her children's education. She needs additional capital to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. Geraldine is hoping to increase her income to help keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en: Arcelita is from Tinidad, Bohol. She is 33 years old, married, and has six children. Her eldest is 13 years old, and her youngest is 3 years old. For 13 years, she has been engaged in a fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy new fish net for her fishing business. This will help her to have an increase in the number of fish caught. This will pave the way to a better income for her family. Her children's school fees will be paid on time and she can buy healthy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Segundina works hard to support her family. She has a business where she buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Segundina is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetable to sell for her business.

Segundina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Aloysious

texts.en:
Aloysious is 45 years old and lives in the town of Paidha in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of whom currently attend school. For the past six years, Aloysious has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap (all types). 

To help expand his business, Aloysious has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale, and will help Aloysious to generate greater profits and increase his inventory. Aloysious hopes that in the future he will be able to use loan profits to pay fees and medical expenses. 

Aloysious is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aloysious who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like sugar and soap for his shop

loans.name: Cionela

texts.en:
Cionela is married and works hard to support her family. For the past eight years, she has run a business selling native bags in the Philippines.

Cionela is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her native-bags business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native bags business

loans.name: Guri

texts.en:
Guri is 27 years old and single. He is from the village of Nagvazao, West Georgia. Guri's only source of income is his milk cow and he produces an average of 25 kilograms of traditional West-Georgian cheese that he sells in the village. His monthly income does not exceed 200 GEL. Guri has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a business start-up, but his loan requests have been rejected because of his low income and poor living conditions. Guri is in the subsistence poor category. 

Guri is requesting a loan from Credo to start a business trading beef and pork. His loan request was approved under a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as high risk borrowers. 

Guri will use his loan to purchase beef and pork from local farmers at wholesale prices and then sell it at the local open market with a price mark-up. His new business initiative will significantly increase his income. Guri hopes to be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beef and pork to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This time, Marilou is borrowing Php 24,000 to fund her general store business. 

This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA partner to continue to provide for Marilou and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lucresia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Lucresia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 42 years old and has a common-law husband. They have seven children, five of whom are in school. Maria Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Teresa runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Maria Teresa has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, noodles, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Maria Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and married with six children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Anita has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

Anita aspires to save enough so that she can provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Filwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme T.HELENE est la représentante du groupe FILWENDE car Mme SUZANE ne fait plus partie du groupe. Elle va bien mais a préféré se reposer. T.HELENE est  mariée  et mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé  a 10ans et  le moins âgé a 06ans. Tous vont  à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend des mangues et tubercules  depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne  à Bobo et Léo  au BURKINA. Ses clients sont  les femmes, elle vend en gros.

Elle veut  s’acheter 25 cartons de mangues.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour améliorer son activité. Elle ambitionne  pouvoir aider son mari pour le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madam T. Helene is the representative of the FILWENDE group as Madam Suzane is no longer part of the group. She is well but preferred to rest. T. Helene is married and mother to 2 children. The eldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 6 years old. Both go to school. She has 1 dependent.

She has been selling mangoes and tubers for 8 years. She gets her supplies in Bobo and Léo in Burkina. Her clients are women and she sells wholesale.

She wants to buy 25 cartons of mangoes.

Madam uses her profits to improve her business. She aspires to be able to help her husband for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy 25 cartons of mangoes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 37-year-old food seller based in the Teshie district of Accra, Ghana. Mary sells cassava, plantains, tomatoes, yams, and onions from her home. She has been in business for seven years. 

Mary's husband is a driver and they have a 17-year-old male child who is in school. 

With a 350 Ghanaian Cedi (GHS) loan, Mary will purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Edelrida

texts.en:
Edelrida is 51 years old and married with three children.

Edelrida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Edelrida has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling fish.

Edelrida aspires to save enough so that she can provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her rope making business.

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
Gladys (pictured center) is a member of the Universal group. Gladys sells cosmetics in the Teshie neighborhood of Accra. 

Gladys' husband is a mason and they have two children, a 12-year-old girl and a 17-year-old boy. 

This is Gladys' first loan from ID Ghana. With her 300 GHS loan she will purchase cosmetics (like those pictured) to sell from her house.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 56 years old and married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, Ligaya works very hard to provide for them.

Ligaya runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Ligaya has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as cup noodles, sugar, biscuits, spices, etc. 

In the future, Ligaya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth (pictured far right) is a member of the God Is Able group, based in the Teshie neighborhood of Accra, Ghana. Elizabeth sells wigs, weaves, shampoo and conditioner from her house. 

This is Elizabeth's second loan with ID Ghana. Her first loan was for just wigs and weaves. After successfully paying back that loan, she will take out this second loan for 300 GHS to expand her business to include shampoo and conditioner.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo and conditioner to expand her cosmetics selling business.

loans.name: Mandel Livingstone Group

texts.en:
Mercy, wearing the green patterned shirt, is a member of the Mandel Livingstone group located in the Teshie district of Accra, Ghana. Mercy sells necklaces in her neighborhood. She has one child, a 9-year-old girl who attends school. 

This is Mercy's second loan with ID Ghana. She will use this loan to purchase more necklaces to sell.

loans.use: To purchase necklaces to sell.

loans.name: L'amour Du Prochain De Ferrer 1 Group

texts.fr:
Ezechiel est le coordinateur  de son groupe L'amour du Prochain de Ferrer 1. Il n´est pas mariee. Il n'a pas d'enfants. Ezechiel habite dans la région de FERRIER d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il a dirigé son commerce de vetement pendant les pour environ 8 ans. 

Ezechiel voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avenduit du Vetement. Ezechiel espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son bussness. Il dit que ses défis principal est de venie un grand commercant
texts.en:
Ezechiel is the coordinator of his group L'amour du Prochain de Ferrer 1. He is not married. He does not have children. Ezechiel lives in the Ferrier region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very scarce. He has been managing his business selling clothing for about 8 years.

Ezechiel would like to use this loan to invest in clothing. Ezechiel hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. He says that his main challenge is to become a great businessman.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is single woman, age 49. She stays in Teshie. She is in the seamstressing business and has been operating this business for 20 years in a kiosk at Teshie. She works from 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

She buys sewing materials such as linen, thread etc., from the central market. Her ambition is to build her own house from the profit she makes. She makes GHS 90 monthly.

She needs GHS 700 to be able to buy more sewing materials.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials such as linen so that she can sew more dresses to sell.

loans.name: Good Seed Group

texts.en:
Matilda is a member of the Good Seed group, which is based in the Teshie neighborhood of Accra, Ghana. 

Matilda sells women's clothing from her home, where she lives with her husband, a mason, and her 5-year old son, who attends school. 

This is Matilda's second loan with ID Ghana (she repaid her first successfully). With this loan she will purchase more women's clothing to sell.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 62 years old and married with adult children. She is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. For the past ten years, Carmelita has run a fishing business and she also farms seaweed, known locally as "guso."  

Carmelita is requesting a loan to buy wooden stakes and plastic rope that are necessary for her seaweed farming. She will use the income generated with her loan to provide nutritious food for her family and save for future use.

loans.use: to buy wooden stakes and plastic rope

loans.name: Sear's Group

texts.en:
Sear is a 62-year-old mother of four children living in one of the rural areas of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is currently only responsible for one child who is helping the family's business, which is growing rice and planting cassava. Sear has been a farmer for 30 years and is able to save about 8 USD daily. The main challenges for her family are sickness and the decreasing price of cassava. 

Sear is the group leader of a loan group that is requesting its first loan cycle. She is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan and her fellow group member is applying for a 1,000,000 KHR loan. Sear will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline for a water pump, and to hire labor to plow her farmland. Sear hopes that she will increase her cassava crop yield and that the price of cassava will increase to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline and hire labor to plow farmland

loans.name: Lamentation De Geremy Group

texts.fr:
Edma est la coordinatrice de son groupe Lamentation de Geremy. Elle habite dans la région de Trou-du-Nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de vente de charbon pendant les 4 dernières années. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le charbon, elle a acheté du bois pour le charbon.

Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires, cosmétiques, vêtements, chaussureset du charbon. Edma dit que son défi principal est en mesure de vendre plus depuis la crise économique en Haïti ne reçoit pas beaucoup d'argent.
texts.en:
Edma is the coordinator of her group Lamentation de Geremy. She lives in the Trou-du-Nord region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very scarce. She has been managing her business selling coal for the last 4 years. She would like to use this loan to invest in coal; she bought wood for the coal.

The other members of the group need a loan for businesses such as selling foodstuffs, cosmetics, clothing, shoes and coal. Edma says that her main challenge is to sell more since the economic crisis in Haiti she does not receive much money.

loans.use: to buy wood for coal.

loans.name: Odillon

texts.fr:
Odillon est né au Rwanda et a 43 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfant de 4 ans à 14 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Odillon est salarie. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 2 camions des pierres, 3000 briques, 2 camions de sable, 40 planches dérives pour sa maison d'habitation.

Pour faire croitre son activité il planifie d’acheter de bon matériels pour rendre sa maison fort. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  construire une autre maison de location pour supporter les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Odillon was born in Rwanda and is 43 years old. He is married with 5 children from 4 years old to 14 years old, of whom 4 go to school. His level of education is 6 years of primary school. Odillon is an employee. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy 2 truckloads of stones, 3000 bricks, 2 truckloads of sand, and 40 center-boards for his home.

To grow his business he plans to buy good materials to make his house strong. In the coming years, he would like to build another home to rent to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy 2 truckloads of stones, 3000 bricks, 2 truckloads of sand, and 40 center-boards.

loans.name: Jose Jesus

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 2 años y 3 meses de edad; a pesar de ser tan joven José es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora  que tiene un gran deseo de superación y muchas ganas de salir adelante con su familia; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo y al esfuerzo de ambos, José puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, en donde su pareja lo apoya realizando ventas en su hogar; con un poco de dinero ahorrado José pudo realizar la compra de una mototaxi, en la cual trabaja un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y puede atender un promedio de 60 clientes, él cree que su negocio marcha bien, debido a su trato amable y respetuoso.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como polos, buzos, chompas, pantalones, entre otras prendas de vestir; de esta manera José podrá tener su negocio de venta de ropa mejor abastecido y con ello espera poder incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos para así con ellos en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder tener una tienda comercial de venta de ropa y con ello poder asegurar el futuro y bienestar de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
José is a 20-year-old gentleman who lives in the city of Chincha with his partner and their two small children, ages 2 and 3 months. Even though he is very young, José is a cheerful and hardworking person who has the drive to succeed and get ahead along with his family. In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors. On other occasions, José enjoys preparing the flavorful "carapulcra" (a spicy Peruvian stew served with dried potatoes) and sharing it with his family.

Thanks to his efforts and the support he received, José took the initiative to open a small clothing business. His partner helps out by generating sales from home. With a little bit of money that he saved up, José was able to buy a motorcycle taxi. He uses this vehicle to work approximately eight hours each day and is able to serve an average of 60 customers. José believes his business is doing well because he provides good service and is respectful.

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support that they will provide, José will be able to buy merchandise such as pullovers, sweatshirts, sweaters, trousers, and other articles of clothing. He hopes to have a clothing business that is better stocked so that he can increase his sales and his income. In the not-so-distant future, José hopes to open a clothing store so that he can secure the future and well-being of his little ones.

loans.use: to buy pullovers, sweatshirts, sweaters, trousers, and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda, 54, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and the mother of five children. Together with her children, she manages a household while operating a business. Merlinda works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Merlinda operates a fruit stand and buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, such as bananas, which are grown mostly in the southern region of Luzon. Merlinda also sells other Filipino fruit staples and she operates a variety store to provide additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Merlinda is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Merlinda faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners that gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
Jeramie is 25 years old and from the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with two children. Her eldest is 4 years old and the youngest is 5 months. 

Jeramie has been in the fishing business for almost two years; this includes catching crab, which is the native people's favorite seafood. Jeramie is dependent on her income from the sea to provide for her children's needs. 

She is asking for a loan to buy gasoline that is needed for the boat for day-to-day operation and to pay for the repair of the engine. Once her income is stable, she can provide for her family's needs, especially for milk and nappies (diapers) for her baby.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and repair the engine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de mercadería, para poder incrementar la venta de especias, comprándose canela, anís, mostaza, orégano, pimienta y almidón, que son los productos que se ofrecen a la clientela a diario.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a Víctor, a poder mejorar el inventario, abasteciendo el negocio de especias que son las que hasta el momento le han dado lo necesario para realizar las ventas.
texts.en:
Víctor is requesting a loan so that he can buy merchandise and increase his sale of spices. He plans to buy cinnamon, anise, mustard, oregano, pepper, and starch. These products are what he offers to his customers every day.

Víctor’s previous loan enabled him to improve his inventory and restock his spice business. At the moment, he has been given what he needs to continue his sales.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon, anise, mustard, oregano, pepper, and starch.

loans.name: Jean Damascène

texts.fr:
Jean Damascène est né au Rwanda et a 53 ans, il est marie avec 8 enfant de 3 ans à 30 ans, dont 5 scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.
Jean Damascène est commerçant. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 2100kgs des tomates pour accroitre son projet de commerce des tomates.

Pour faire croitre son commerce, il planifie de solliciter d’autres crédit pour augmenter les capacités de son commerce et satisfaire le marché. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  être le grossiste et être le grand commerçant. Avec les profits, il prévoit de bâtir une maison à usage résidentiel et améliorer le niveau de mange de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Damascène was born in Rwanda and is 53 years old. He is married with 8 children from 3 years old to 30 years old, of whom 5 go to school. He has 1 dependent other than his children. His level of education is 6 years of secondary school.

Jean Damascène is a businessman. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy 2100 kgs of tomatoes to grow his project of selling tomatoes.

To grow his business, he plans to request other loans to increase the capacity of his business and to satisfy the market. In the coming years, he would like to be a wholesaler and a great businessman. With the profits, he plans to build a house for residential use and improve the level of nutrition of his family.

loans.use: to buy 2100 kgs of tomatoes.

loans.name: Vivian Group

texts.en:
Vivian is a group leader of Vivian’s group. They are two women with the average age of 40 years. They sell items like cassava, yams, vegetables and cooking oil. They are married with an average of three children.

Vivian (in the black blouse standing right in the picture) sells cassava and cooking oil. She buys the items from Kade, a village in the eastern part of Ghana. She sells at the central market in Accra and stays at Teshie. She needs this loan to expand her business by buying more cassava, plantains, and cooking oil, with which she can make a profit of GHS 100.
 
They need an amount of GHS 1,100 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy cassava, plantains and cooking oil so that she can meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a cellphone and cellphone accessories store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional units of cellphones and accessories.

Grace has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional units of cellphones and accessories.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 40 years old and is married and blessed with three children. She is from the village of Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Merlita's husband is a farmer who cultivates their farm. For the past seven years, Merlita has raised bananas to sell to make a living and she earns 11,200 PHP each month. She recently joined GDMPC to gain financial services from the cooperative to provide an additional investment for her existing business. 

Merlita is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase banana fertilizer for her plants. She will use the income generated from her loan to expand her business. She additionally hopes that the continued success in her business will allow her to have a good life.

loans.use: to purchase banana fertilizer

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear items in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like t-shirts, pants, shoes and other ready-to-wear items.

Julie has been in this business for 4 years. Julie earns more income from the general store.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like t-shirts, pants, shoes and other ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is a resident living in Kampong Chhnang province. He is 28 and married to a local farmer. He has two school-aged children. 

Ut helps his wife in managing the rice-farming business within the rainy season, and the rest of time, he is in the transportation business. He uses an old motorcycle to provide services to people in his neighborhood. Typically, he is able to make an average of USD $2.00 per day from this business. Ut starts his work schedule in early morning and works until five o’clock. He tries hard to earn money because he wants to provide a good living for his family and help his two children earn a degree later.

At present, Ut would like to request a loan in the amount of KHR 600,000 to add to his capital to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, cement, small stones and sand. This loan will be sufficient funds for Ut to repair and renovate his present house. He hopes that he will be able to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, cement, small stones and sand.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past three years, she has run a clothing business in the Philippines.

Aileen is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses, and other ready-to-wear clothing. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Appolonie

texts.fr: Appolonie est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 24 ans, mariée, sans enfant mais elle a deux personnes à sa charge. elle vend depuis un a des vivres frais dans un quartier de la ville. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des tomates, condiments verts, gombo, etc pour augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. avec les bénéfices générés, elle voudrait davantage aider son aider à supporter les charges domestiques.
texts.en: Appolonie is a young Cameroonian who is 24 years old, married, without children but she has two dependents. She has been selling fresh food supplies in a neighborhood of her town for one year. With this loan she would like to buy tomatoes, green condiments, gumbo, etc. to increase her stock of merchandise in order to satisfy the demand of her clientèle. With the profits generated, she would like to increasingly help her husband to take care of their domestic responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, green condiments, gumbo and other merchandise.

loans.name: Ma.marivit

texts.en:
Ma. Marivit is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo to sell in her sari-sari store.

NWTF is relisting Ma. Marivit's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is 18 years old from Nablus. She is married and has one child. 
Farah owns a shoe workshop for tailoring shoes and selling them, and has one employee who helps her. Her shoe workshop is the only shop in the area.
She asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy more shoe-tailoring machines in order to increase productivity.

Her ambition is to enlarge her project and develop it to improve her income, and have her kids working in it in the future.

loans.use: to buy more shoe-tailoring machines

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 37 years old and married with one child.

Shirley works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Shirley has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Shirley aspires to save enough money to buy a new lot.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Birame

texts.fr: Monsieur Birame réside au  Sénégal. Il est marié et vit avec sa famille. Il s’est  orienté dans le secteur  du  commerce principalement dans la vente de denrée alimentaire depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il sollicite un  crédit d’un montant de 200.000 francs CFA dans le but de renforcer son  fonds de roulement. Le montant  qu’il emprunte est prévu pour l’approvisionner  en denrées  destinées à la vente. Le renforcement de son stock de ^produits  lui  permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Par conséquent  l’augmentation de ses bénéfices  lui donnera la possibilité d’épargner davantage de l’argent et  d’avoir la capacité  d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Dans le futur, il aspire à devenir un grossiste.
texts.en:
Mister Birame lives in Sénégal. He is married and lives with his family. He has worked in the business sector primarily in the sale of foodstuffs for more than 10 years.
