He is a member of one of the branches of the UIMCEC where he is requesting a loan of 200,000 FCFA with the goal of strengthening his working capital. The sum that he is borrowing will be used to stock up in foodstuffs to resell. 

Strengthening his stock of products will allow him to better satisfy his clientèle's demand. Consequently, the increase in his profits will allow him the possibility to save more money and to have the ability to improve the nutritional conditions of his family. In the future, he hopes to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to stock up in foodstuffs to resell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Vicenta works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell for her general store.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of items to sell

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en: For 18 years now, Bernalda has been in the fishing business to support her family. Bernalda is married with five children. Her eldest is 18 years old and the youngest is 6 years old. She and her family live in Trinidad, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy a new fish net for easier fishing. Bernalda hopes that with the loan, she can continually improve her business so she can meet the needs of her family. Her income will be for her children's education and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net

loans.name: Dalmacia

texts.en:
Dalmacia is 57 years old and is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zambonga del Sur. She is married and blessed with two children. Dalmacia’s husband provides transport services for their community to help the family to earn a living.

Dalmacia works in an agricultural business project raising domestic animals (primarily pigs) to earn an income. She has been in this business for almost three years and earns about PHP 8,000 PHP per month. 

The previous loan taken by Dalmacia was intended to buy feeds and was really used. She sells her raised domestic pigs and she was able to pay her obligation in the cooperative and took a new loan now for the new piglets raised.

Presently, Dalmacia joined GDMPC to gain financial services from the cooperative as supplementary capital for her existing business. She requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase feeds for her domestic pigs for their growth. 

Dalmacia plans that the income generated from her loan will be invested back into the business and ultimately hopes to expand the business. Additionally, Dalmacia hopes that continued success in her business will allow her to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 58 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and blessed with six children. Her husband is a farmer. She established her own small business to help support her husband in generating income for the family. Genara works in the agricultural business, raising pigs to sell commercially. She has been active in this business for 26 years and has generated a good return to date and earns about PHP 22,300.

Prior to this loan she took about PHP 10,000 to purchase livestock and feed and other supplies. This loan was successfully done and she was able to repay her amortization. 

Recently she join GDMPC and applied for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase feed for the pigs' growth and nourishment. She plans that in the near future a portion of the income generated will be reinvested into the business for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food sales business.

NWTF is relisting Condrada's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food sales business.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 28 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 5 years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her salon, where she plaits and treats hair as well as sells cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics, and will help Teopista to generate greater profits and expansion in business. Teopista hopes that in the future she will be able to reach a wholesale level. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teopista who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
This is Tomasa, a 51-year-old resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, who is employed, and she is the mother of her children. By the grace of God, Tomasa has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to sustain their daily expenses.

Tomasa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Tomasa hopes to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetable to sell for her business.

Susan has been in this business for 18 years. Susan earns more income from the general store.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
This is Pinky. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Pinky dreams of being able to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 65, is resident of Cavite, Philippines, and is married to Rolando, a jeepney operator. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a direct-selling business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Teresita sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer who has one month to pay on credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers gain as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also operates a canteen. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 44, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Teresita hopes to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 35 лет. В 2010 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Назира начала свой бизнес в торговле детской одеждой. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Назира сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 20,000 сом (KGS). Товар Назира закупает на рынке столицы, приезжая 2 раза в месяц и делая закуп в среднем на 30,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Назира обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Назира  планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Nazira is 35 years old.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business of selling children's clothing in 2010.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Nazira was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  She buys merchandise valued at an average sum of 30,000 som (KGS) at a market in the capital twice per month.  Today, her merchandise selection is limited and this is why Nazira requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further development of her business.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store business.

NWTF is relisting Cresencia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her store like shampoo, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.
